column3: Detect the running platform and set ChromeDriverServiceFileName accor…
column4: …dingly ("chromedriver" or "chromedriver.exe")  Although I couldn't build this project on mono, and a zillion unit tests failed in windows, the changes in this pull request are extremely simple and straightforward, and I was able to manually test in windows.  If you create a project and add Selenium via NuGet, I confirmed that I was able to use chrome in windows, but the new ChromeDriver() constructor threw exception in mono.  This pull request enables the new ChromeDriver() constructor to work in mono, and allows selenium to work with chrome on OSX (and hopefully other linux/unix variants)

column3: Allow peristent profile for FirefoxProfile
column4: You can specify a profile template when you create a new FirefoxProfile and FirefoxProfile.layoutOnDisk() return a temporary files which is a copy of the profile.  It is good for isolated unit testing. But selenium may be used for other things than unit testing, and one wants to use persistent profile so data like sessions, cookies, caching and local storage may be saved in the profile after selenium shutdown.

column3: "spellcheck" should not be a binary attribute
column4: With the following HTML: `` Calling `webDriver.findElement(By.id("myInput")).getAttribute("spellcheck")` returns "true" instead of "false".  In fact, it returns "true" for any value of the "spellcheck" attribute, and only returns "null" when the attribute is not defined at all. This behavior is consistent with HTML5 binary attributes, but "spellcheck" is not a binary attribute.   According to HTML5 specification: (https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/infrastructure.html#boolean-attributes)  > The spellcheck attribute is an enumerated attribute whose keywords are the empty string, true and false. The empty string and the true keyword map to the true state. The false keyword maps to the false state. In addition, there is a third state, the default state, which is the missing value default (and the invalid value default).  So, the "spellcheck" is actaully an enumerated attribute, and it does have a third state. Treating it as a binary attribute is not a good idea.  The example code comes from a real world scenario - Chrome needs 'spellcheck="false"' to disable spell-check on inputs (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4524000/turn-off-chrome-safari-spell-checking-by-html-css)

column3: Support ECMAScript 6 Template Literals
column4: With Selenium IDE 2.9.1 and current Firefox (44),  ```  `...${javascript-expression}...` ```  in Selenese command parameters (target or value) should evaluate javascript expression as per ECMAScript 6 template literals. Hence, within template literals  ```  `...` ```  Selenium shouldn't replace ${...} with values of any stored variables.  ``` getEval | friend='John' storeEval | 'Max' | friend getEval | alert( `Hello ${friend}.` )  or (more 'real'):  storeEval | 'Max' | friend .... getEval | var friend='John'; alert( `Hello ${friend}.` ) ``` ## Expected behavior  --> Hello John. ## Actual Behavior  --> Hello Max. ## Fix, related Selenese docs and ES6 specification  Modify Selenium.prototype.replaceVariables() as per its override in https://github.com/SeLite/SelBlocksGlobal/blob/master/sel-blocks-fx_xpi/chrome/content/extensions/selblocks.js.

column3: Add .NET bindings for WiniumDriver

column3: IE driver server 64 bit is typing very slowly using Sendkeys
column4: Win 7 using IEdriverserver 64 bit vesrion exe.  IE driver server 64 bit is typing very slowly using Sendkeys. Protected Mode is ON for all zones and zoom level set to 100%  Is below statement true? The driver supports running 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the browser. The choice of how to determine which "bit-ness" to use in launching the browser depends on which version of the IEDriverServer.exe is launched. If the 32-bit version of IEDriverServer.exe is launched, the 32-bit version of IE will be launched. Similarly, if the 64-bit version of IEDriverServer.exe is launched, the 64-bit version of IE will be launched. ***Copied from "https://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/InternetExplorerDriver"

column3: Selenium::WebDriver::Error::UnhandledAlertError: Modal dialog present:
column4: While running Ruby test on a site, when an alert dialog appears then the subject error appears if testing against IE 11 with Win32 driver version in Windows 7 x64 (x64 driver version does not work under this system). There is no way to close this alert by means of Ruby because the error crashes the testing process and does not react to commands like `browser.alert.ok` or `browser.alert.close`.  The same code works good with Google Chrome.  See screencast for details: http://www.screencast.com/t/feYJGHHT2E9m  (sorry for the video quality)  UPD: Added a better video and script code below in comments.

column3: Selenium IDE - Webdriver Playback - Window per Test Case Fix
column4: While running a Selenese test suite using Webdriver Playback (experimental) in the Selenium IDE a browser window per case was opened. Webdriver Playback now keeps track of the lastSessionId used in the previous case and continues to use that session for subsequent cases preventing additional browser windows from opening.  P.S.  I realize this needs a refactor, I'm unsure of the best way to do it however.  My knee jerk reaction is to wrap the entire file in an iife to make the lastSessionId "private", export all of the "public" bits and potentially eliminate self.sessionId.

Even if we check the check box 'ask before download' it is not prompting for download path.  Chrome Version: 44.0.2403.155 m Selenium server 2.44 Chrome driver version: 23.0.1240.0

column3: Firefox PATH not used on Windows.
column4: Whenever I try to run selenium-java tests with version 2.47.1.on Firefox 38 WIndows platform execution fails. I get this error:  ``` java.lang.RuntimeException: org.openqa.selenium.WebDriverException: Cannot find firefox binary in PATH. Make sure firefox is installed. ```  Firefox is on standard installation PATH="C:\Program Files (x86)\Firefox\38.01\firefox.exe" After som investigation I found out that selenium code has some expectation from the PATH. In org.openqa.selenium.firefox.internal.Executable we try to call locateFirefoxBinaryFromPlatform(); This uses WindowsUtils.getPathsInProgramFiles("Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe"); This PATH cannot match in newer version. Can you fix the implementation, so it matches whichever PATH is given or put it in separate environment variable?

column3: check if xpi system property is different from an empty string
column4: When using the Firefox driver, I found that instead of loading the default xpi extension, Selenium tries to load an empty string as the file path for the xpi. This is because System.getProperty(FirefoxDriver.SystemProperty.DRIVER_XPI_PROPERTY); returns an empty string.   So this pull request adds a small check to see if the xpi path is also different from an empty string.

column3: getPageSource() bug! (facebook webdriver(php) - firefox)
column4: When trying to get page source after navigating to an url which contains "#"(bookmark) I recieve the last source before the current get().  Example:  $webdriver->get('http://www.domain1.com'); echo md5($webdriver->getPageSource()); // source1  $webdriver->get('http://www.domain1.com/anotherRoute#test'); echo md5($webdriver->getPageSource()); // source2 == source1  If I change the domain: $webdriver->get('http://www.domain1.com'); echo md5($webdriver->getPageSource()); // source1  $webdriver->get('http://www.domain2.com/anotherRoute#test'); echo md5($webdriver->getPageSource()); // source1 != source2  I made some test locally and the webbrowser navigated correctly. Only the html sources got by selenium are the same.

column3: Wrong option name for tracing categories in dotnet bindings
column4: When trying to add tracing categories I have the error : unrecognized performance logging option: tracingCategories in the logs  to reproduce this issue :   ``` ChromePerformanceLoggingPreferences perfLogPrefs = new ChromePerformanceLoggingPreferences();  perfLogPrefs.AddTracingCategory("devtools.timeline"); options.PerformanceLoggingPreferences = perfLogPrefs;  ChromeDriverService service = ChromeDriverService.CreateDefaultService(); service.LogPath = "chromedriver.log"; service.EnableVerboseLogging = true; service.SuppressInitialDiagnosticInformation = true; ChromeDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(service, options); ```  In the ChromeOption.cs at line 667 the option added in the dictionnary is  "tracingCategories" and I think it should be "traceCategories". See the code example [https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/logging/performance-log](url) under "Tracing and Custom Logging". I was able to make tracing work with this code before the last update. The documentation here [https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/capabilities](url) seems wrong.

column3: .Net default WebRequest timeout is too short and not configurable for requesting sessions from Selenium Grid
column4: When the RemoteWebDriver makes an HTTP request to the Selenium Grid hub, the hub will wait until it can create the session on a node before responding. If this takes longer than 60 seconds then the HttpWebRequest will timeout on the .Net Selenium client, leaving the Grid with a pending session request that will eventually be fulfilled and an exception that the Selenium client has to deal with.  I thought I could just keep retrying to create the session when I catch the timeout exception but this creates an infinite cycle of failure because all the previous requests are still enqueued on the hub, meaning that they will be fulfilled eventually and then time out due to no client traffic after a configurable period of time.  This issue is exacerbated by using IE because each node can only support one instance of it no matter how powerful it is.

column3: Selenium fetching wrong debug info with window 10
column4: When the execution fails, selenium giving os name as windows 8.1 instead of windows 10 _Message:org.openqa.selenium.remote.SessionNotFoundException: Unexpected error launching Internet Explorer. column3: Selenium IDE click fails on pages that include Polymer's platform.js

Why is it not possible to alter 'javascript.enabled'

column3: Add encoding=utf-8 to add_on's open(install.rdf) line.
column4: When running Selenium on windows, and installing an add-on to firefox, it chokes on this particular line:  ``` File "C:\Python34\lib\site-packages\selenium\webdriver\firefox\firefox_profile.py", line 343, in _addon_details     manifest = f.read() File "C:\Python34\lib\encodings\cp1252.py", line 23, in decode     return codecs.charmap_decode(input,self.errors,decoding_table)[0] UnicodeDecodeError: 'charmap' codec can't decode byte 0x81 in position 990: character maps to  ```  Specifying an encoding at the open line seems to resolve this. CLA signed.

column3: Microsoft Edge WebDriver doesn't send "backslash" under german keyboard layout
column4: When i try to send a backslash via Microsoft Edge WebDriver, the backslash is not been send under german keyboard layout. Under english keyboard layout it works.  e.g.: sending keys via  ``` 15/2/2016 13:15:27 - Request POST http://localhost:17556/session/SESSION_ID/element/ELEMENT_ID/value {     "value": [         "x\\Sx"     ] } ```  will result in `"xSx"` instead of `"x\Sx"` if german keyboard layout is selected. If english keyboard layout is selected, everything works fine.  I've opened a bug at microsoft: https://connect.microsoft.com/IE/feedbackdetail/view/2361895

column3: Python Firefox webdriver can fail on slow systems
column4: When I try to load Firefox webdriver in python using: `webdriver.Firefox()`  It occasionally fails after around 30 seconds with below traceback:  ``` Traceback (most recent call last):   File "", line 1, in    File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/firefox/webdriver.py", line 77, in __init__     self.binary, timeout),   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/firefox/extension_connection.py", line 49, in __init__     self.binary.launch_browser(self.profile)   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/firefox/firefox_binary.py", line 68, in launch_browser     self._wait_until_connectable()   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/firefox/firefox_binary.py", line 103, in _wait_until_connectable     raise WebDriverException("Can't load the profile. Profile " selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: Can't load the profile. Profile Dir: %s If you specified a log_file in the FirefoxBinary constructor, check it for details. ```  I am almost sure it's to do with hardcoded 30 seconds timeout in firefox_binary.py:101. When I changed that value to 60 it started working.  I tried to load webdriver like this: `webdriver.Firefox(timeout=60)`  but after looking at the code the timeout is not actually used so made no difference  How to replicate: - this issue can only be seen on slow systems (like RaspberryPi) where firefox takes over 30 seconds to start - the following python code can be used to replicate the problem:  ``` from selenium import webdriver browser = webdriver.Firefox() ```

column3: "DevTools Request: 127.0.0.1:12585/json/version. DevTools request failed" when loading Chrome user data with a Chrome window already open
column4: When I create a new chrome driver in Selenium while Google Chrome is already running AND I am referencing the users settings/data (via `user-data-dir`). A new Chrome window will open, but my application will hang. The ChromeDriver console will display the following error each second:   `DevTools Request: 127.0.0.1:12585/json/version. DevTools request failed`  This will work perfectly fine in every time if I do not try and load user settings/data. If I am trying to load user setting/data it will only work if there is no instance of Chrome running on the device already.  I am not sure if this is a bug, or my own ignorance. Hopefully the later.  Versions: - Selenium v 2.47.0 - ChromeDriver v 2.16.333243 - Chrome v44.0.2403  Possibly related to: https://github.com/angular/protractor/issues/1636 ?  Edit: code snippet for reference:  ```     ChromeDriverService driverService = ChromeDriverService.CreateDefaultService();     //driverService.HideCommandPromptWindow = true;     driverService.EnableVerboseLogging = true;      string path = Environment.ExpandEnvironmentVariables("%LOCALAPPDATA%\\Google\\Chrome\\User Data");      ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();     options.AddArguments("user-data-dir=" + path);     options.AddArguments("--start-maximized");     options.AddArguments("--disable-extensions");      IWebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(driverService, options); ```

column3: IDE records selectWindow instead of selectFrame
column4: When I click on a field in a iFrame and then click elsewhere, Selenium IDE records `selectWindow` command in all cases instead of `selectFrame`.  In the editor.js file (`addCommand` function) the `LastWindow.prototype.isSameTopWindow` method currently returns false whenever the current window is not the top window, even if the two frames are under the same top window.  ``` javascript Editor.prototype.addCommand = function (command, target, value, window, insertBeforeLastCommand) {    [...]    if (!this.safeLastWindow.isSameWindow(window)) {       if (this.safeLastWindow.isSameTopWindow(window)) {         // frame          [...]       } else {         // popup          [...]       }    }    [...] }  LastWindow.prototype.isSameTopWindow = function (window) {   if (this.window == null || window == null) {     return false;   }   if (this.isTopLevel && window.top == window.top.parent) {     // top level window     return this.topName == window.top.name;   } else if (this.parent == window.parent) {                 return this.window.top === window;   }   return false; }; ```

column3: Selenium + phantomjs fails to obtain appropriate page source while urllib2 succeeds
column4: When I attempt to obtain the html for the following urls with selenium and phantomjs, it fails by returning a much smaller response than expected while urllib2 seems to return the correct result.  http://www.brit.co/meet-the-maker-amber-goodvin/ http://www.nationaljournal.com/sponsored-content/api/energy-tomorrow  I've noticed this on numerous occasions and can source further URLs if required. Here is my setup for both: ### selenium approach  ``` from selenium import webdriver cap = webdriver.DesiredCapabilities.PHANTOMJS cap["phantomjs.page.settings.resourceTimeout"] = 30 cap["phantomjs.page.settings.loadImages"] = False driver = webdriver.PhantomJS('phantomjs', desired_capabilities=cap)  url = 'http://www.nationaljournal.com/sponsored-content/api/energy-tomorrow' driver.get(url) html = driver.page_source ``` ### urllib2 approach  ``` import urllib2 response = urllib2.urlopen(url) url = 'http://www.nationaljournal.com/sponsored-content/api/energy-tomorrow' html = response.read() ```  Any feedback would be greatly helpful.

This is using Firefox 43.04 and Selenium 2.49.2.  ``` tests/pages.py:225: in fill_form     return self.click_button('Send') ../envs/olu/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keteparaha/page.py:316: in click_button     return self._click(component, opens) ../envs/olu/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keteparaha/page.py:263: in _click     component._element.click() ../envs/olu/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webelement.py:75: in click     self._execute(Command.CLICK_ELEMENT) ../envs/olu/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webelement.py:454: in _execute     return self._parent.execute(command, params) ../envs/olu/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py:201: in execute     self.error_handler.check_response(response) _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _  self =  response = {'status': 500, 'value': '{"name":"clickElement","sessionId":"4407bbb1-373d-4e9d-a780-9ced144767ab","status":13,"value...ould receive the click: "}'}      def check_response(self, response):         """             Checks that a JSON response from the WebDriver does not have an error.              :Args:              - response - The JSON response from the WebDriver server as a dictionary                object.              :Raises: If the response contains an error message.             """         status = response.get('status', None)         if status is None or status == ErrorCode.SUCCESS:             return          value = None         message = response.get("message", "")         screen = response.get("screen", "")         stacktrace = None         if isinstance(status, int):             value_json = response.get('value', None)             if value_json and isinstance(value_json, basestring):                 import json                 try:                   value = json.loads(value_json)                   status = value.get('error', None)                   if status is None:                       status = value["status"] >                     message = value["value"]["message"] E                     TypeError: string indices must be integers ```

column3: EventFiringWebDriver: added an event on "submit()"
column4: When "recording" the interaction with a page, there's the need to record the "submit" action. For us, this is similar to a "click()", so then we decided to dispatch the "click" event, but maybe a new "submit" event could be dispatched...   --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/seleniumhq/selenium/1179)

column3: Pass command-line arguments to Firefox
column4: WebDriver should provide a way to pass [command-line arguments](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Command_Line_Options#How_to_use_command_options) when launching Firefox

column3: LGPL v2.1 license of JBoss-logging
column4: We want to distribute selenium as part of our product. But selenium has an LGPL license for JBoss-logging which prevents us from shipping due to legal issues.  \selenium-server-standalone-2.48.2.jar: META-INF/license/LICENSE.jboss-logging.txt   JBoss-logging moved to Apache license in 2012. Here is the link: https://github.com/jboss-logging/jboss-logging/blob/master/src/main/resources/META-INF/LICENSE.txt  But the netty 3.5.7 (bundled in selenium jar files) has this jboss-logging which is still having this license. The latest versions of netty doesn't have LGPL.   Can you upgrade the netty or use jboss-logging under apache license. This will help us overcome legal hurdle in distributing selenium with our product.

column3: sendKeys does not work with FirefoxDriver 2.48.2
column4: We try to set the value of an input element using selenium-firefox-driver 2.48.2 and Firefox ESR 38.0.1. But the input element remains empty. Please find a testcase below.  ``` @Test public void standalone() {     final WebDriver driver = new FirefoxDriver();     driver.get("https://www.theice.com");      final WebElement login = driver.findElement(By             .cssSelector("a[href*='login']"));     login.click();      final WebElement options = driver             .findElement(By                     .xpath("//div[@class='selectbox-main']/a/span[text() = 'Select an Option']"));     options.click();      final WebElement option = driver.findElement(By             .xpath("//ul/li/a[text()='Deal Reports']"));     option.click();      final WebElement username = driver.findElement(By             .xpath("//input[@placeholder='Username']"));     username.sendKeys("test");     // input field in browser remains empty!      driver.close(); } ```

column3: sendKeys in InternetExplorerDriver doesn't always send keys
column4: We stumbled over the seldom occuring issue that InternetExplorerDriver won't enter some text into text fields, leaving them blank.  To reproduce and isolate the problem, I've created [a small Selenium/Java script](https://gist.github.com/outofrange/d92be829255120134bd2) that simply enters increasing numbers into a text field and asserts the value of the HTML tag, for 30 minutes. After a few seconds or minutes, the text field stays empty and the assertion fails; my expectation is, of course, that `sendKeys` will send keys on every invocation, or at least throws an exception if there is a problem. Most of the time, we are able to reproduce the problem with this method before we reach 300 - the longest we had to wait was until 839.  In this case, I'm reading the `value` of the input field immediately after calling sendKeys, but even when looking at the browser after the assertion, the characters won't appear, so I don't believe it's a timing issue.  Both Selenium and IEDriver are at version 2.45.0, and we could reproduce it on a machine with Win7 + IE8, and on another one with Win7 + IE11, although it's rarer on IE11 (meaning it takes longer until it happens) Windows is 64bit, IE and IEDriver are 32bit. We are using Java 1.8.0_51 (x64)  It seems that `requireWindowFocus` = true is relevant.  Since I haven't found anything about this problem on the internet, are we the only ones having these troubles?

column3: firefox: Explicitly scroll element into view before clicking
column4: We still have a bunch of failures with "Element is not clickable at point..." on CI  cc @barancev

column3: Selenium standalone server creates zombie processes
column4: We run a fairly aggressive distributed selenium grid, executing ~200 tests per node machine per hour. Each test is run using a new chrome driver instance. We have found that the memory on our nodes gradually fills up. After some investigation, we found that our selenium standalone server was holding on to thousands of handles to dead chromedriver instances. Each one was taking up 20kb of ram, and no longer attached to any live process / PID. After resetting the server, these zombie processes were immediately released from memory. At present we have not attempted to replicate the issue using firefox/IE or through local execution.   ![zombie processes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6556555/10207594/3cc3adf4-6782-11e5-9a25-84a7dedb2440.png)

column3: Selenium standalone server creates zombie processes AFTER CALLING driver.quit()
column4: We run a fairly aggressive distributed selenium grid, executing ~200 tests per node machine per hour. Each test is run using a new chrome driver instance for each test, and properly calling driver.quit() at the end of each test. We have found that the memory on our nodes gradually fills up. After some investigation, we found that our selenium standalone server was holding on to thousands of handles to dead chromedriver instances. Each one was taking up 20kb of ram, and no longer attached to any live process / PID. After resetting the server, these zombie processes were immediately released from memory. At present we have not attempted to replicate the issue using firefox/IE or through local execution.  ![zombie processes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6556555/10232681/fa91598c-683e-11e5-9040-4e90c6c02303.png)

column3: Selenium-hub 2.52.0 crashes after updating webdriver
column4: We recently updated all our Selenium infrastructure from 2.43.1 to 2.52.0, and the browsers from Firefox 33 to 44. column3: Memory leak in org.openqa.selenium.io.TemporaryFilesystem
column4: We have a long run environment to playback selenium scripts. The command to start the remote server is as the following.  java -Xdump:java:events=user -jar -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/opt/my/logging.properties /opt/my/selenium-server-standalone-reduced-2.47.1.jar -timeout 3600 -browserTimeout 3600  Find that the real memory consumption of this process keeps growing over time. ## Expected Behavior -  The real memory consumption of the selenium-server-standalone process should not grow overtime with steady load. ## Actual Behavior -  The heap dump of the selenium server process shows that the class "java.lang.ApplicationShutdownHooks", loaded by "", occupies 97,222,648 (93.28%) bytes.  And there are large number of org.openqa.selenium.io.TemporaryFilesystem$1 objects (159724 in my case) dominated by class "java.lang.ApplicationShutdownHooks" and keeps growing over time.  ![dominator_tree](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15373664/13215020/95602dde-d98d-11e5-9905-77eefeac5d60.jpg) ## Steps to reproduce -  No special steps.   PS: for each test, we stop the BMP proxy and run driver.quit.  Cloud you advise how to find the root cause of this issue? Thanks.

column3: Some site controls disappear when doing scroll using WebDriver Actions class
column4: We have a grid in our web application. We have a framework with selenium webdriver based test cases in it. When next code is executed during tests: **_public void doubleClick(WebElement element)     {         Actions actions = new Actions(webDriver);         actions.doubleClick(element).build().perform();     }**_ (element is a cell in a grid, which is out of screen before double click) - the page is scrolled to the cell and doing double click. But at the same time a container above our grid (with menus, buttons etc.) just disappear. And in addition an empty rectangle appears below the grid with about the same size as disappeared container. _Note: But when element is not out of screen before doing click - the issue does not exist. So the problem, indeed in the scrolling_  I consulted with our development team - they did some investigations and concluded that actually page is not changed. And elements should be on their places (still above the grid) and after doing  OneLinkJQ('.OPE_Panel2').hide() OneLinkJQ('.OPE_Panel2').show() (.OPE_Panel2 points to the hidden part) - the container with all elements become visible again.  Issue exists on Firefox 40.0.2, IE 11 (latest updates).  On Chrome issue is not reproduced. Manually issue is not reproduced. Only while executing Java code. Selenium version - 2.46.0 (and 2.47.1 as well) OS - Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 x64 #   See images: before executing "actions.doubleClick(element).build().perform();" ![1 before scroll](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7655829/9358103/1092de18-4693-11e5-8489-10316a2f359f.png) and after ![2 after scroll](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7655829/9358104/10968b94-4693-11e5-8f12-51b286603fd3.png)  I can provide more information if needed.

column3: Python selenium webdriver throws unicode Attributes errors
column4: We are using python selenium webdriver , of late we see error like `, AttributeError("'unicode' object has no attribute 'text'",), )` .   We are using 2.45 version of selenium python version 2.7.7 .   And also we see this problem intermittently ? Is it a known issue , when i dug into source code of webdriver.py it has a line `str= basestring` which should fix most of the unicode errors. Since it happens intermittently its hard to provide more logs

column3: Unable to enter text in second consecutive textbox(Sometimes) when running tests on jenkins(Centos) with FirefoxDriver
column4: We are using jenkins along with xvfb plugin to run selenium tests using FirefoxDriver. When any webpage have two text boxes consecutively(e.g. userame, email etc on signup page) sometimes the text for both the textboxes entered into first textbox only(e.g. UserName: myUserNamemyEmailAddress) instead of entering myEmailAddress in Email field. The web application is designed using springboot and tapestry frameworks. For now as workaround we are using pauses between both text boxes to work. But this is not expected as we are providing element for both text boxes it should enter value to that specific text box only. I don't know exactly why it is happening may be its very fast running tests but the thing is elements are different then how it possible, please let me know the details if possible.

column3: Unable to find elements on IE 11, Windows Server 2012 R2
column4: We are having some issues finding elements using WebdriverJS with IE 11 on Windows Server 2012 R2.  The same code works fine on Windows 7/8/8.1, so I'm pretty sure that points to some sort of configuration issue on our side.  We've performed the IE configuration found here:  https://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/InternetExplorerDriver  We're attempting:  driver.isElementPresent(By.tagName('body'));  And it results in:   NoSuchElementError: Finding elements with tag name == bodyreturned an unexpected error (WARNING: The server did not provide any stacktrace information) Command duration or timeout: 311 milliseconds For documentation on this error, please visit: http://seleniumhq.org/exceptions/no_such_element.html Build info: version: '2.45.0', revision: '5017cb8', time: '2015-02-26 23:59:50' System info: host: 'ip-0AC8460B', ip: '10.200.70.11', os.name: 'Windows Server 2012 R2', os.arch: 'amd64', os.version: '6.3', java.version: '1.8.0_51' Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.ie.InternetExplorerDriver Capabilities [{browserAttachTimeout=0, enablePersistentHover=false, ie.forceCreateProcessApi=true, ie.usePerProcessProxy=false, ignoreZoomSetting=false, handlesAlerts=true, version=11, platform=WINDOWS, nativeEvents=true, ie.ensureCleanSession=true, elementScrollBehavior=0, ie.browserCommandLineSwitches=-extoff -nohangrecovery, requireWindowFocus=true, browserName=internet explorer, initialBrowserUrl=http://localhost:29760/, takesScreenshot=true, javascriptEnabled=true, ignoreProtectedModeSettings=false, enableElementCacheCleanup=true, cssSelectorsEnabled=true, unexpectedAlertBehaviour=dismiss}] Session ID: d8981e6a-7c0a-4b50-806e-8493c1546f0e **\* Element info: {Using=tag name, value=body}  Anyone have any suggestions on what configuration we can check?  Are there any known issues with Selenium on Windows Server 2012 R2?

column3: WebDriver.Timeouts setScriptTimeout for SYNCHRONOUS scripts?
column4: We are having issues of the JavaScriptExecutor (WebDriver/RemoteWebDriver) not returning from executeScript if an action results in a new page during a synchronous script call.  Timeouts.setScriptTimeout says it only applies to asynchronous scripts with a registered callback function.  Can we not get timeouts built-in for synchronous javascript calls, too?  Currently, we have to implement our own timeout running in a separate thread.

column3: Take Commons Collections v3.2.1 off classpath
column4: Version 3.2.1 has a CVSS 10.0 vulnerability. That's the worst kind of vulnerability that exists. By merely existing on the classpath, this library causes the Java serialization parser for the entire JVM process to go from being a state machine to a turing machine. A turing machine with an exec() function!  https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-collections/security-reports.html http://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/

column3: Webdriver get text includes space from within HTML tags
column4: Using this perl webdriver code (simplified for the example):  ``` perl my $page_header = $webdriver->find_element( 'pageHeading', 'id' )->get_text; like(                     $page_header,                     qr/PageTitle]/s,                     "Page \"PageTitle\" loaded after it was set to default and has correct heading"                 ); ```  I was getting this error (note the leading space)  ```     #   at page_headers.test line 342.     #                   'PageTitle'     #     doesn't match '(?^s: PageTitle)' ```  The problem turned out to be a trailing space in the HTML element:  `PageTitle`  get_text should not be getting spaces in the html tag before the closing angle bracket.

column3: Any command in Selenium IDE cause javascript alerts to stop showing
column4: Using newest Firefox 39.0 + Selenium IDE 2.9.0.  When I run any Selenium IDE command on any webpage which contains javascript alerts, these alerts stop working. Alert resume working if I close Selenium IDE window.  I reproduced it also on this simple HTML page:  ``` HTML                        blahblah       ```  That page is supposed to show alert(123) after clicking on text blahblah. It works until I run anything in Selenium IDE.  Then I run a simple Selenium command from Selenium IDE, for example: `type / test / test`  After that if I click on text blahblah, no alert will popup.  This issue is probably new (several weeks max), may be caused by some Firefox update.  The issue can cause many invalid bugs during web application testing.

column3: Clicking zero-area element with nonzero-area children has unexpected results
column4: Using `Python 3.4.3 :: Anaconda 2.3.0 (64-bit)` with package [selenium 2.48.0](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/selenium/2.48.0) and Firefox 40.0.3 on Windows 8.1.  I expect that calling [click](http://selenium-python.readthedocs.org/api.html#selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement.click) on a zero-area element should either raise an exception or click a nonzero-area child element. ~~The latter behavior mirrors what "actually" happens. Clicking the child element below myself triggers the onclick event for the parent element -- but with WebDriver it does not!~~ Edit: that's not true.  To test copy the contents below into two files, amend `test.py` script to enter the path to `test.html`, then run `test.py`.  `test.html`:  ``` html             Zero area test case              .nonzero_child {             position: absolute;         }         .zero_area {             display: inline;         }                   function do_something() {             alert("Hi ho!");         }             Foo    ```  `test.py`:  ``` python from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.common.alert import Alert  driver = webdriver.Firefox()  driver.get("file:///path/to/test.html")  # Put in the appropriate value here.  element = driver.find_element_by_class_name("nonzero_child") element.click() Alert(driver).accept()  # Works ok   element = driver.find_element_by_class_name("zero_area") element.click() Alert(driver).accept()  # Throws an error  ```

column3: Change in behaviour breaks clicking on popup span.
column4: Using 2.47.1 with Firefox worked with our website. Upgrading to 2.48.0 ( or 2.48.1 / 2.48.2) stopped working on a click on a particular element on the website. We use selenium to click on an element and it pops up a series of numbers in spans. The clicking on these spans seems to be broken now in that the onclick doesn't get processed for the span.  I git bisected to commit 0eec81da52ba4dfb16de590e6e82ebafa452416f Specifically line 202 of javascript/firefox-driver/js/syntheticMouse.js of the above commit. (line 294 of current master)  ``` javascript   bot.action.click(element, this.lastMousePosition, this.getMouse_()); ```  If I change the line to  ``` javascript   bot.action.click(element, this.lastMousePosition, new bot.Mouse(null, this.modifierKeys)); ```  it works again.

column3: HtmlUnitDriver with DefaultCredentialsProvider sends credentials to every endpoint
column4: Using     @Override     protected WebClient modifyWebClient(WebClient client) {         DefaultCredentialsProvider credentials = new DefaultCredentialsProvider();         credentials.addCredentials(username, password, domain, port, realm);         client.setCredentialsProvider(credentials);         return client;     }  it will still send credentials to other pages that does not match the realm. In fact it will send it on pages that do not send a challenge in the first place.  It seems that the credentials are chosen the first time they are needed, and then they are used forever.

column3: Properties of IWebElement are not visible in VisualStudio 2013
column4: use Selenium WebDriver C# and PageFactory (PageObject) pattern to create automated tests. I develop them in Visual Studio 2013.  Before the latest version of Webdriver (now I use 2.47.0) it worked well but now I face the next problem: I can not view properties of my web elements.  Here is how I create and initialize an element:  public class MyPageObj : DriverCover {         public MyPageObj(IWebDriver driver) : base(driver)         {             //'Driver' is a EventFiringWebDriver (IWebDriver) from parent class             PageFactory.InitElements(Driver, this);         }  ```     [FindsBy(How = How.CssSelector, Using = "#internal")]     private IWebElement _myElement; ```  }  When I run tests and at a breakpoint I want to watch properties of _myElement I see only non-public members: http://prntscr.com/8o075p  If I don't use PageFactory and find elements using Driver.FindElement(By.How()) method it works well.

column3: Fix log to file for Windows (Use platform-dependant separator)
column4: Use platform-dependant line separator instead of hardcoded '\n'.  Fixes logging to file for Windows.

column3: Reduces time wasted in when using a native driver
column4: UrlChecker normally adds 1 second to any test that creates and destroys a DriverService such as the ChromeDriver since the initial poll on both startup and shutdown nearly always fails and the time between polls (500 millis) is high.  This switches to using an initially small but exponentially increasing poll time in order to waste much less time waiting for nothing.  CLA signed.

column3: TargetLocator no longer exported
column4: Upgrading from `2.48.2` to `2.52.0`; `TargetLocator` was previously exported as `WebDriver.TargetLocator`, but now we need to `require("selenium-webdriver/lib/webdriver").TargetLocator`.  Was this an intentional breaking API change or a regression?   Should I expect semver?

column3: rb capabilites spec now expects MicrosoftEdge instead of edge
column4: Update spec for https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/1002, which changed the browser_name from "edge" to "MicrosoftEdge".  Today is my first time checking out the selenium code.  Running the `/go test_rb` produced this one failure:  ```   1) Selenium::WebDriver::Remote::Capabilities has default capabilities for Edge      Failure/Error: caps.browser_name.should == "edge"        expected: "edge"             got: "MicrosoftEdge" (using ==)      # ./rb/spec/unit/selenium/webdriver/remote/capabilities_spec.rb:40:in `block (2 levels) in ' ```  It seems to have been introduced with: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/574b37cd7e5006aa8a8e183456a6dd1c4ceabe5a . fyi @lukeis  I signed the CLA.

Using Java in selenium webdriver  XPATH: ++++++ //*[@id='full-scorecard']/div[2]/div/table[1]/tbody/tr[3]/td[2]/child::text()  HTML: +++++  12.6  caught Hughes  73/4    Selenium code which isn't working: +++++++++++++++++++++++++++ WebElement txt= driver.findElement(By.xpath(    "//*[@id='full-scorecard']/div[2]/div/table[1]/tbody/tr[3]/td[2]/child::text()"));  System.out.println(txt);

column3: DON'T MERGE - Testing Travis CI failures
column4: Travis only kicks off with PRs, will delete after verifying test.

column3: Selenium IDE blocked by Firefox 43.0.1 because it is not signed.
column4: Today, my installation of Firefox was upgraded to 43.0.1.  After restart, Selenium IDE (and some other add-ons) had been disabled, because of a missing add-on signature, referring to [Add-on signing in Firefox](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/add-on-signing-in-firefox). Developers are directed to [Signing and distributing your add-on](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/Distribution) from there.  An attempt to install the latest version from the [Selenium IDE add-on page](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/selenium-ide/?src=search#id=2079) is also blocked. The "+ Add to Firefox" button has an alarming yellow/orange color and clicking it will invoke a pop-up message from the address bar stating that Firefox has prevented this website from asking me to install software on my system (the actual message is in Dutch, so I have translated it.)  Please, provide a signed release of the Selenium IDE add-on, as I want to use is, but do not want to swith of the xpinstall.signatures.required preference in about:config.

column3: JQuery Mobile Checkbox click issue with Selenium WebDriver DotNet 2.51.0 for Firefox
column4: To reproduce the issue, go to the following url:   http://demos.jquerymobile.com/1.4.5/checkboxradio-checkbox/  and try to click the checkbox named: "checkbox-0 " with Selenium WebDriver DotNet 2.51.0 for Firefox.  Code:  ```         driver.Navigate().GoToUrl("http://demos.jquerymobile.com/1.4.5/checkboxradio-checkbox/");          WaitUntilExists("Minisize", driver);          driver.FindElement(By.Name("checkbox-0 ")).Click();          Assert.IsTrue(driver.FindElement(By.Name("checkbox-0 ")).Selected, "Error: the checkbox is not checked."); ```  Error:  OpenQA.Selenium.WebDriverException : Unexpected error. Element is not clickable at point (34.44999694824219, 504.70001220703125). Other element would receive the click: ``  The code runs as expected with version 2.48.1 of Selenium WebDriver DotNet for Firefox  Thanks.

column3: Add textContent attribute support to HtmlUnitDriver
column4: To be consistent with WebRemoteDriver, textContent attribute should retrieve textContent of the underlying DOM Node.

column3: Add innerHTML attribute support to HtmlUnitDriver
column4: To be consistent with WebRemoteDriver, innerHTML attribute should retrieve innerHTML of the underlying DOM Node. (Same idea as #1205)

column3: Making ChromeDriver directly implement HasTouchScreen interface.
column4: To be able to use org.openqa.selenium.interactions.touch.TouchActions with chrome mobile emulation (see https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/mobile-emulation) ChromeDriver should implement HasTouchScreen interface. In other case, it would be impossible to use ChromeDriver to simulate mobile evens such as flick or scroll in hub+node architecture (see issue https://code.google.com/p/chromedriver/issues/detail?id=1029), because ChromeDriver on hub doesn't't have touch screen capability. With ChromeDriver implementing HasTouchScreen it is possible to augment RemoteWebDriver on the client side and use touch actions.

column3: Move selenium-webdriver node project into a separate GitHub repo
column4: This would make it easier for people to fork it and set their fork as a dependency for their project. npm doesn't support setting a subdirectory in a git repository as a dependency: https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/2974

column3: Remote PhantomJS execute_async timeout
column4: This works directly through phantomjs driver (2.0) (macosx), but not through remote driver, which makes me think there is an issue in remote driver, but it could also be something wrong with ghostdriver.  With this post:  ``` -> POST session/e59737f0-7224-11e5-aecc-7519eb3ec57b/execute_async    >>> http://127.0.0.1:8910/session/e59737f0-7224-11e5-aecc-7519eb3ec57b/execute_async | {"script":"return 1 + 2;","args":[]}      > {"Accept"=>"application/json", "Content-Type"=>"application/json; charset=utf-8", "Content-Length"=>"36"} ```  Local Response has correct status of 28:  ```

column3: Updating to 2.49 fails while creating driver with error as "The SearchContext of the locator object cannot be null"
column4: This was working before, now after the upgrade fails with the below error message? "The SearchContext of the locator object cannot be null"  Fails at this line PageFactory.InitElements(TrialMaster.Browser.TMDriver, loginPage);   This works using 2.45 .net lib.

column3: SafariDriver Immediately Releases Click Events. Does not Check Pending Navigation.
column4: This was reported in 2014 but never triaged/addressed. See [Google Code - Open Issues](https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=8001&can=1&q=browser%3DSafari%20component%3DWebDriver%20status%3ANew%2CAccepted%2CWorkingAsIntended%2CWontFix%2CNotFeasible&sort=-id&colspec=ID%20Stars%20Type%20Status%20Priority%20Owner%20Summary%20Browser%20Component)  **The issue:** After clicking a link / button using SafariDriver, it appears there is no check for pending navigation requests before releasing the click event as complete.   **The Consequence:** Click actions which result in a page refresh or redirect are released before the refresh/redirect occurs and thus proceeding actions are kicked off too early and fail consistently.   **The Workaround:** Add element level waits after click-through events to stop SafariDriver from submitting the next actions too early. Downside is the element-wait timeout is being eaten up by page load. Moreover, because the click has been released as successful, any failure is attributed to the next action rather than the click.   **The Solution:** Have SafariDriver behave similar to ChromeDriver in which pending navigations are checked before releasing the click action. My fear is that there is a good reason why SafariDriver cannot do this, and perhaps this is why the issue was never addressed. If this is the case, it would just be great to understand the limitation and hear if there are better / other workarounds.  Here are some details from the original ticket post to help illustrate the matter.  **SafariDriver log:**  ``` 14:37:57.86 [safaridriver.extension.Server] [779h50wyyvq2] Received a message: {"origin":"webdriver","type":"command","command":{"id":"79","name":"clickElement","parameters":{"id":":wdc:1412681861302"}}} 14:37:57.87 [safaridriver.extension.Server] [779h50wyyvq2] Executing command: clickElement 14:37:57.87 [safaridriver.extension.Tab] [2ymt8tn075fa] Sending message: {"origin":0,"type":"command","command":{"id":"9hv7rx7u2env","name":"clickElement","parameters":{"id":":wdc:1412681861302"}}} 14:37:57.87 [safaridriver.inject._Top_] [p1s4okvij0cl] Executing {"id":"9hv7rx7u2env","name":"clickElement","parameters":{"id":":wdc:1412681861302"}} 14:37:57.88 [safaridriver.extension.Tab] [2ymt8tn075fa] Received response: {"origin":1,"type":"response","id":"9hv7rx7u2env","response":{"status":0,"value":null}} 14:37:57.88 [safaridriver.extension.Server] [779h50wyyvq2] Sending response: {"origin":0,"type":"response","id":"79","response":{"status":0,"value":null}} ```  **ChromeDriver log:**  ``` [26.534][INFO]: COMMAND ClickElement {    "id": "0.7670850940048695-14" } [26.534][INFO]: Waiting for pending navigations... [26.534][INFO]: Done waiting for pending navigations [26.594][INFO]: Waiting for pending navigations... [38.981][INFO]: Done waiting for pending navigations [38.981][INFO]: RESPONSE ClickElement ```  under SafariDriver response for click action is being sent immediately after click but, this click leads to another page and it should send a response when new page loaded(like under ChromeDriver).  **Selenium Version:** 2.48.2 / 2.49.0 **OS Version:** Mac OS X Yosemite / El Capitan  **Browse Version:** Safari 9.0 / 9.0.1 / 9.0.2

column3: Assume a valid alternate hostname.
column4: This test is not valid without a valid alternate hostname as it makes calls to: ...#getAlternateHostName() ...#getUrlForSecondValidHostname(String)

column3: De-flake ImplicitWaitTest.
column4: This test hits an ArrayOutOfBoundsException a little over 1% of the time on my continuous build. This fix waits until we're sure there are two open windows before attempting to reference the second window.

column3: Update webdriver.js
column4: This statement should be terminated.

column3: Sort Grid Proxies in order of least busy to busiest.
column4: This should prevent situation where one node is running multiple sessions while several nodes are completely idle.  In this code we sort all of the proxies based on the current amount of running tests on each, 0 being on top n+1 being last. This does not sort the proxies in order of % business, but still is a huge improvement over the previous set up.

column3: Address TypeError: string indices must be integers
column4: This should address the error documented here: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/1497  Yes, it's ugly code.. alternatives welcome.

column3: Can't send key combinations in Safari
column4: This problem was raised on the old issue tracker: https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=8118  [Here is the Watir spec that fails just for safari](https://github.com/watir/watirspec/blob/master/element_spec.rb#L308) It treats [:command, 'a'] as if just 'a' was entered. :backspace works correctly.

column3: fixed README and index.rst for Python documentation
column4: This PR fixes issues with the python README and index.rst docs.  issues fixed that were reported in #1137: - fixed broken table that was making the document invalid reStructuredText.  In its current state, rendering of the document on PyPI is broken. (it shows raw source rather than rendered reStructuredText)     - see: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/selenium/2.48.0   - this is a regression introduced by commit: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/3fc2db275149748b21ea0370d3d3ace2df7c2676 - changed supported Python versions to be more generic:   - replaced "Python 2.6, 2.7" with "Python 2.6+"   - replaced "Python 3.2, 3.3" with "Python 3.2+"  other fixes: - renamed page from "Selenium Client Driver" to "Selenium WebDriver Client - Python Bindings", and removed redundant description. - updated server download location and server run command to reflect version 2.48.0 (it wasn't updated since 2.46) - tweaked link to GitHub for viewing source - fixed a typo in page: s/uisng/using  Note: `py/docs/source/index.rst` is a copy of `py/README` and should be kept in sync.  This PR updates both docs.

column3: Add Node.js WebDriver client for Microsoft's Edge browser
column4: This PR adds a WebDriver client for Microsoft's Edge browser in Node.js that can be created and managed via the Builder API. The PR is essentially broken down to the following: - A ServiceBuilder class that manages the MicrosoftWebDriver server in a child process. - An Options class for configuration options for each new session created when starting the browser. - A WebDriver client specific to Microsoft's Edge browser.  The CLA is already signed.

column3: Bug add extension
column4: This patch solves problem with adding of firefox plugin into profile.  We sort the list of files (folder is first and files are then).  In my case, I got this error message  `"OSError: [Errno 17] File exists: '/tmp/tmpYr3loo.firebug-2.0.12.xpi/content/firebug/net/'``

column3: Fix python 2/3 unicode() compatability in selenium.py
column4: This patch is a simple fix for the use of the `unicode` built-in that no longer exists in python 3:  An example:  ``` python >>> from selenium.selenium import selenium >>> s = selenium('localhost', 4444, '*firefox', 'http://example.org') >>> s.start() Traceback (most recent call last):   File "", line 1, in    File "/home/matt/.virtualenvs/selenium/lib/python3.4/site-packages/selenium/selenium.py", line 202, in start     result = self.get_string("getNewBrowserSession", start_args)   File "/home/matt/.virtualenvs/selenium/lib/python3.4/site-packages/selenium/selenium.py", line 237, in get_string     result = self.do_command(verb, args)   File "/home/matt/.virtualenvs/selenium/lib/python3.4/site-packages/selenium/selenium.py", line 216, in do_command     body = 'cmd=' + urllib_parse.quote_plus(unicode(verb).encode('utf-8')) NameError: name 'unicode' is not defined ``` - [x] By placing an `X` in the preceding checkbox, I verify that I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#step-6-sign-the-cla)

column3: Chrome 46 causes WebDriverException
column4: This morning, we started having all of our automated builds fail with an exception   ```  The HTTP request to the remote WebDriver server for URL http://localhost:/session timed out after 60 seconds. ```  At first, I was unable to reproduce locally. Then I noticed our server was running Chrome 46 and I was running 45. I restarted my chrome to upgrade to 46, and now local tests fail as well. There seems to be an incompatibility between the chromedriver and Chrome 46

column3: sendKeys sends numbers one digit at a time in firefox
column4: this issue is similar to https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=7809 and http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23412912/selenium-send-keys-doesnt-work-if-input-type-number which have been issues with firefox and numeric inputs in the past.  with firefox 41 and selenium 2.47.1, calling WebElement.sendKeys("123") will just send the first digit.  to successfully send all digits I have to call sendKeys in a loop for each digit.  to reproduce, you need an ``.  no issue with other input types.  IE and Chrome web driver's work fine with input type of number.

column3: Selenium::WebDriver::Error::UnknownError (Permission denied to access property "constructor"):
column4: This issue is arising for just 2  test cases out of 10. On production  browser.iframes.each do |iframe|          count = iframe.iframes.count rescue 0          # puts "IN iframe_locator ", count.inspect         if (count == 0)            frame, id = iframe_locator(iframe,index)             all_frames

column3: Ensure you can close stream before attempting to.
column4: This is to resolve the [issue](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/1469) introduced by [recent refactoring](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/0ee1c15d7dd98344cd2e35e7a4bfa92561e4a686).  For some webdriver types the streams in `self.process` are `None`.

column3: Update TestSession.forward to allow CommandListener to modify the response
column4: This is to allow proxies that implement CommandListener to modify the response from the node before it's forwarded to the remote.  For example a custom capability could be injected into the response that tells the client a URL for a live video capture of the session.

column3: Clear() number inputs doesn't work
column4: this is still an issue for me. (I just updated to Selenium Standalone 2.49.1) I've tried the suggestions in this [question](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/32326978/the-clear-function-does-not-work-on-input-of-type-number) and did  numInput.click(); browser.sleep(1000); numInput.clear().sendKeys('5);  but this solution only seems to work sometimes. often what happens is the input gets cleared but then fills in the previous value before sending the new value. i'm not sure what to do. I'm using Protractor 3.0.0 as well but they directed me over here

column3: Firefox Driver sendKeysToActiveElement
column4: This is on Firefox 45 on OSX, with the Firefox Driver. I'm seeing this behavior both local & via remote server. I tested with FF 45 before it was released and didn't see this behavior, and I'm pretty sure we're testing this in the CI. So, I'm not sure why I'm seeing this right now. Can anyone duplicate? ## Expected Behavior -  Post to session/:session_id/keys should type into body of page ## Actual Behavior -  Opening a page and sending key command is putting the text into the url bar:  ## Steps to reproduce -  `````` -> POST session/942089a8-b772-4c9a-9a14-78ce2a76c5f8/url    >>> http://127.0.0.1:4444/wd/hub/session/942089a8-b772-4c9a-9a14-78ce2a76c5f8/url | {"url":"http://ci.seleniumhq.org:2310/common/javascriptPage.html"}      > {"Accept"=>"application/json", "Content-Type"=>"application/json; charset=utf-8", "Content-Length"=>"66"}17:02:30.845 INFO - Done: [new session: Capabilities [{rotatable=false, nativeEvents=false, browserName=firefox, takesScreenshot=true, javascriptEnabled=true, version=, platform=ANY, cssSelectorsEnabled=true}]] 17:02:30.851 INFO - Executing: [get: http://ci.seleniumhq.org:2310/common/javascriptPage.html]) 17:02:31.169 INFO - Done: [get: http://ci.seleniumhq.org:2310/common/javascriptPage.html]  POST session/942089a8-b772-4c9a-9a14-78ce2a76c5f8/keys    >>> http://127.0.0.1:4444/wd/hub/session/942089a8-b772-4c9a-9a14-78ce2a76c5f8/keys | {"value":["ab"]}      > {"Accept"=>"application/json", "Content-Type"=>"application/json; charset=utf-8", "Content-Length"=>"16"} 17:02:31.174 INFO - Executing: [send keys to active: [ab]]) 17:02:31.234 INFO - Done: [send keys to active: [ab]]

column3: DNS Resolution
column4: This is an improvement ticket. Please have a look. ## Expected Behavior -  Remaps host file entries for Selenium automation. If you have application running on multiple servers(like primary, secondary etc.) and you want to run your selenium automation suite against a specific server you can achieve it but by adding DNS host mapping in your host file located at following windows box location **windows/system32/drivers/etc/**.  This is done manually by most of the automation tester. Can be automated with no manual intervention using BrowserMob Proxy. BrowserMob Proxy a free utility to help web developers. ## Actual Behavior -  Request here is can Selenium team incorporate it internally. https://github.com/lightbody/browsermob-proxy#dns-resolution ## Steps to reproduce -  Following is a demo URL with steps to achieve this. http://switchhostinselenium.blogspot.in/2016/03/dns-resolution-in-selenium-automation.html

column3: Report user extension/plugin error stack
column4: This is an enhancement suggestion.  What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have a custom/third party extension/plugin for Se IDE, which fails on load 2. Se IDE shows the error message and line number, but not the file name. 3. Se IDE lists all user-provided files, but there may be several extensions (incl. 3rd party), so it's not clear to the developer which is broken.  What is the expected output? What do you see instead? - in addition to the current error details, the stack trace is very needed.  Selenium version: 2.9.1 Firefox 44.0 Suggested change in chrome/content/editor.js: from       this.showAlert(Editor.getFormattedString('user.extensions.failed', [error.toString()])); to       this.showAlert(Editor.getFormattedString('user.extensions.failed', [error.toString()+ '\n' +error.stack]));  (Originally reported as https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=5423.)

column3: Starting with Chrome 44 can't tab away from the initial focus object if it is the body
column4: This is a real simple problem that started with Chrome 44, and I don't know if it is a Chrome problem, or WebDriver problem.  On the website that I am testing the initial element that is focused after load is the body element. If I try to send a Tab to it to tab to the next element, the focus does not advance. (Java code) (Navigate to a page...) WebElement intialElement, currentElement, lastElement; initialElement = driver.switchTo().activeElement(); //. //.intialization //. currentElement = initialElement; do {    lastElement = current Element;    currentElement.sendKeys(Keys.TAB);    currentElement = driver.switchTo().activeElement(); //. //. test code here //. while (!currentElement.equals(lastElement) && !currentElement.equals(initialElement))  The problem that I am running into, starting with Chrome 44, is that the first element is the body element, but if I send a tab to it the focus does not advance to the next object.

column3: Selenium IDE does not mouseMove or mouseOver elements
column4: This is a known issue, but nobody seems to be addressing it and it renders Selenium IDE virtually useless.  When adding a mouseMove/mouseOver command(s), the hidden elements that should become visible on hover remain hidden.  Using the same command in PHPSelenium works just fine.  How can we fix this??  Thanks.

column3: WebElement.isEnabled() should check for actual element state rather than looking at disabled attribute in the dom
column4: This is a feature request for the nodejs bindings - WebElement.prototype.isEnabled()  ``` /** 2124     * Schedules a command to query whether the DOM element represented by this 2125     * instance is enabled, as dicted by the {@code disabled} attribute. 2126     * @return {!webdriver.promise.Promise.} A promise that will be 2127     *     resolved with whether this element is currently enabled. 2128     */ 2129    webdriver.WebElement.prototype.isEnabled = function() { 2130      return this.schedule_( 2131          new webdriver.Command(webdriver.CommandName.IS_ELEMENT_ENABLED), 2132          'WebElement.isEnabled()'); 2133    }; ``` # Scenario  Call isEnabled() on a web element that is disabled, but the element does not have a disabled attribute.   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2752830/11599922/603c103a-9a7e-11e5-83b9-37356eccddcd.png) ## Page object  BasePage: Internal ui library, where the native selenium bindings are called  ``` /**  * Safe enabled status getter for element enabled status to check for negative states  * @param locator  * @param timeout  * @returns {!promise.Promise.}  */ BasePage.prototype.isEnabled = function(locator, timeout) {     timeout = timeout || WAIT_TIME_NOT_PRESENT;     var defer = Promise.defer();     var driver = this.driver;     // Explicitly wait for the element to be visible     var element = driver.findElement(locator);     driver.wait(Until.elementIsVisible(element),timeout).then(function () {         Logger.debug('Element is visible : ' + locator);         // If its located check of if it is enabled         element = driver.findElement(locator);         driver.wait(Until.elementIsEnabled(element),timeout).then(function() {             driver.findElement(locator).isEnabled().then(function(isEnabled) {                 Logger.verbose('Element : ' + locator + ' isEnabled() : '+ isEnabled);                 defer.fulfill(isEnabled);             }).thenCatch(function (err)  /* error call back*/{                 Logger.verbose('Element is NOT enabled : ' + locator);                 defer.fulfill(false);             });         }).thenCatch(function (err) /* error call back*/ {             Logger.verbose('Element is NOT enabled after waiting, error : ' + err.stack);             defer.fulfill(false);         });     }).thenCatch(function (err) /* error call back*/ {         Logger.verbose('Element is NOT enabled after waiting, error : ' + err.stack);         defer.fulfill(false);     });     return defer.promise; }; ```  SignupPage: Returns the promise of the element state  ``` /**  * Gets the enabled status of the Save button  * @returns {!webdriver.promise.Promise.|!promise.Promise.}  */ SignupPage.prototype.isCreateButtonEnabled = function() {     this.waitForDisplayed(By.css(CREATE_ACCOUNT_SUBMIT_BUTTON));     return this.isEnabled(By.css(CREATE_ACCOUNT_SUBMIT_BUTTON)); }; ``` ## Usage in mocha  ```         signup.isCreateButtonEnabled().then(function (isEnabled){             assert.equal(isEnabled, false, 'Create button should be disabled');         }); ```  On asserting, the value coming back is **true** even when the element is actually disabled.  On reading the docs in detail it seems like we are looking for disabled attribute instead of checking actual state. See attached debug stack.  **Expected behavior** : the returned value to be **false**  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2752830/11599992/ce7074e2-9a7e-11e5-8b1c-98a73db74ed9.png)

column3: Selenium 2.48 on MacOS fails to scroll to element to click
column4: This happens only on Mac OS + selenium 2.48  (works on all platforms with 2.47, and on win+linux on 2.48) Happens when clickable element not fitting by width into browser window - click just not happening Tested on Yosemite and El Capitan  ```         final String uniqueLink = "a[href*='path=clickMe']";         final String testUrl = "http://dimkin.eu/zzzz/s6.html";         final String textForVerification = "someLongNameToMakeTable";          RemoteWebDriver driver = new FirefoxDriver();         driver.manage().window().setSize(new Dimension(20, 500));         driver.get(testUrl);         driver.findElement(By.cssSelector(uniqueLink)).click();         assertFalse(driver.getPageSource().contains(textForVerification));//this will fail on MacOs + sel 2.48 only          driver.manage().window().setSize(new Dimension(1200, 500));         driver.get(testUrl);         driver.findElement(By.cssSelector(uniqueLink)).click();         assertFalse(driver.getPageSource().contains(textForVerification));         driver.quit();     } ```

column3: Fix property modification from the command line
column4: this fixes https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/1106

column3: Alert dialog dismissed automatically when UnhandledAlertError raised
column4: This change was introduced in [selenium-webdriver 2.18.0](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/rb/CHANGES#L408):  > Firefox and IE: > - Raise UnhandledAlertError if an alert is present during an operation. The unhandled alert is also dismissed to mitigate repeat exceptions.  I believe this change is in error, because it creates several problems: 1. It becomes impossible to write a step that asserts the presence of the alert and dismisses it, if any prior step triggers an UnhandledAlertError. 2. The behaviour varies between Firefox / IE and Chrome.

column3: .Net: The Class target was added to PageObject attributes
column4: This change change provides to end user some additional options.  For example User needs to develop page object like that:  ``` csharp //[FindsBySequence] [FindsBy(How = How.Id, Using = "SomeId", Priority = 1)] [FindsBy(How = How.ClassName, Using = "SomeClass", Priority = 2)] //and so on //the construction above describes how to find the root element class PageObject { [FindsBy(How = How.TagName, Using = "SomeTag")] IWebElement e; //this is the nested element } ```  At this case they only need to develop their own customized [IPageObjectMemberDecorator](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/dotnet/src/support/PageObjects/IPageObjectMemberDecorator.cs) implementation that can handle classes/members like above

column3: rb - update file loading to allow tests to be run from relative directories
column4: This came up as an issue at the selenium conference workshop when the Ruby group couldn't find an easy way to run a single ruby test in the project.  With this code we can run specific spec files within the selenium/rb directory like this: export WD_SPEC_DRIVER=chrome; rspec spec/integration/selenium/webdriver/driver_spec.rb This also allows running from within Rubymine (importantly including using the debugger).  @p0deje - I changed spec_support.rb to require_relative instead of autoload for RackServer. I didn't dig into why RackServer needs to be lazy loaded; I'm guessing it's because we don't need it if we're just running unit tests. That doesn't seem to be much overhead, but if the "right answer" to this is easy and better, let me know, otherwise let's merge this.  (also, I ran ./go test_rb on my mac with this code and everything passed).

column3: Grid Stuck When > ~500 Tests Are Executed In Parallel With ChromeDriver
column4: This became an issue sometime after version [2.47.1](http://selenium-release.storage.googleapis.com/2.47/selenium-server-standalone-2.47.1.jar). I tested two versions, [2.48.2](http://selenium-release.storage.googleapis.com/2.48/selenium-server-standalone-2.48.2.jar) and [2.52.0](http://selenium-release.storage.googleapis.com/2.52/selenium-server-standalone-2.52.0.jar) and they both get stuck.  I duplicated this issue locally using a single computer with a grid running 5 instances. My real grid environment has 100 browser instances available, hence why I sometimes have 500 tests queued.  I am using ChromeDriver [2.21](http://chromedriver.storage.googleapis.com/index.html?path=2.21/). ## Expected Behavior  Each test iteration opens a new Chrome browser and runs the test normally. ## Actual Behavior  The first set of browsers get stuck on the initial `data:,` screen in Chrome. ## Steps to reproduce 1. Start the hub    - No Issue: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.47.1.jar -role hub`    - Issue: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.52.0.jar -role hub` 2. Start a node    - No Issue: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.47.1.jar -role node -hub http://localhost:4444/grid/register -Dwebdriver.chrome.driver=c:\selenium_drivers\chromedriver.exe`    - Issue: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.52.0.jar -role node -hub http://localhost:4444/grid/register -Dwebdriver.chrome.driver=c:\selenium_drivers\chromedriver.exe` 3. Run the test    - `mvn clean test`    - Three files below #### testng.xml  ``` xml                                            ``` #### src/test/java/com/mytest/AppTest.java  ``` java package com.mytest;  import java.net.MalformedURLException; import java.net.URL;  import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver; import org.openqa.selenium.remote.DesiredCapabilities; import org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver; import org.testng.annotations.DataProvider; import org.testng.annotations.Test;  public class AppTest {      @Test(dataProvider = "dp")     public void test1() throws MalformedURLException {         DesiredCapabilities caps = DesiredCapabilities.chrome();         WebDriver driver = new RemoteWebDriver(new URL("http://localhost:4444/wd/hub"), caps);         driver.get("http://google.com");         driver.quit();     }      @Test(dataProvider = "dp")     public void test2() throws MalformedURLException {         DesiredCapabilities caps = DesiredCapabilities.chrome();         WebDriver driver = new RemoteWebDriver(new URL("http://localhost:4444/wd/hub"), caps);         driver.get("http://google.com");         driver.quit();     }      @Test(dataProvider = "dp")     public void test3() throws MalformedURLException {         DesiredCapabilities caps = DesiredCapabilities.chrome();         WebDriver driver = new RemoteWebDriver(new URL("http://localhost:4444/wd/hub"), caps);         driver.get("http://google.com");         driver.quit();     }      @DataProvider(name = "dp", parallel = true)     public static Object[][] dp() {         return new Object[500][0];     } } ``` #### pom.xml  ``` xml      4.0.0     com.mytest     ManyTests     0.0.1-SNAPSHOT                                             org.apache.maven.plugins                 maven-surefire-plugin                 2.19.1                                                               testng.xml                                                                                             org.testng             testng             6.9.10                               org.seleniumhq.selenium             selenium-server             2.52.0                               org.seleniumhq.selenium             selenium-java             2.52.0                ```

column3: selenium-webdriver depends on vulnerable ws module
column4: There's a remote disclosure vulnerability in `ws`, which is used by the node `selenium-webdriver` package. See https://github.com/websockets/ws/releases/tag/1.0.1 — not sure what impact it has here.  Bumping the version to `1.0.1` in https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/javascript/node/selenium-webdriver/package.json#L29 seems to work fine: it builds and the tests pass. I can submit a PR if needed.  /cc @jleyba

column3: Ruby client for remote driver is slow
column4: There seems to be a 1 second delay on each command to a remote driver from Ruby. Using the same remote driver and test script, running from a .NET script took 9 seconds and from a Ruby script took 33 seconds. The remote driver log shows that command responses were delivered in typically 0.2 seconds in each case.  Is there some wait or delay built into Ruby? I can't see anything mentioned in the docs or source... It seems unlikely that Ruby itself could be so slow, and the delay of almost exactly 1 second per command looks too regular to be caused by language performance.

column3: Clicks to Internet Explorer not responding with WebDrive Plus and Python
column4: There is an issue involving InternetExplorerDriver and WebDriver plus. The IE browser is not responding to clicks when I run my scripts, but Firefox and Chrome work just fine. I’ve searched the literature and found a good answer for a similar problem involving WebDriver (no Plus) at https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=4403:  DesiredCapabilities d = DesiredCapabilities.internetExplorer(); //d.setCapability("nativeEvents", false); webdriver = new InternetExplorerDriver(d);  I have been unable to find a similar approach for WebDriver Plus with Python where the driver is instantiated by:  self.driver = WebDriver("ie", wait=5)

column3: Opera webdriver: Quit() lets the browser running
column4: There is a problem in the Opera webdriver :  Calling driver.Quit() shuts down correctly the webdriver but may let the Opera browser running.  Important: This happens ONLY if you set the path to the executable with: OperaOptions.BinaryLocation = "C:\Program Files\Opera\launcher.exe";  while when setting the path to OperaOptions.BinaryLocation = "C:\Program Files\Opera\34.0.2036.25\opera.exe";  it will work correctly.  Selenium users will not understand what is wrong there: The browser starts, all tests execute correctly but at the end the browser keeps running forever.  SOLUTION: The Selenium driver should throw an exception if the user passes a path to "....\launcher.exe" instead of the "....\opera.exe".

column3: Check element corners and middle for clickability
column4: There has been a lot of discussion in Issue #1202 about the recent changes to click behavior in FF.  IMHO the new behavior makes more sense from a user emulation POV, however it does lack the ability to click on partially covered elements which a user definitely could.  This PR checks the elements four corners as well as the middle for clickability and therefore allows a click on an element that is partially covered.  It also fixes some CSS in an existing ruby test  CLA has been signed

column3: Usage examples in javascript/node/selenium-webdriver document incorrect flag
column4: The usage examples in under the node package states incorrectly.  ``` javascript  * Usage: node --harmony-generators \  *     selenium-webdriver/example/google_search_generator.js ```  I'm using v0.12.1 and I found that the correct usage is actually.  ``` javascript  * Usage: node --harmony \  *     selenium-webdriver/example/google_search_generator.js ```  Basically you need to replace flag `--harmony-generators` with `--harmony` otherwise various different ES6 errors are thrown.

column3: Fix tracing for `WebDriver#getPageSource`
column4: The tracing for sending the `getPageSource` command instead identified the command as `getAllWindowHandles`

column3: Add a check for null results from executing JavaScript
column4: The System.Type.IsInstanceOfType method will always return false when handed a null value. This change checks explicitly for null to prevent an exception from being thrown in this case. A check for a value type is also made to avoid attemping to convert to a value type from a null value.  Fixes #1257

column3: Enhance check for value types to exclude Nullable
column4: The System.Nullable type is a value type that can be assigned the null value. This change checks for types wrapped with Nullable and does not throw when they are encountered.  Fixes #1316
