column3: BadStatusLine in quit.
column4: I am seeing the following error:  ```   File "venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium-2.44.0-py2.7.egg/selenium/webdriver/chrome/webdriver.py", line 82, in quit     self.service.stop()   File "venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium-2.44.0-py2.7.egg/selenium/webdriver/chrome/service.py", line 97, in stop     url_request.urlopen("http://127.0.0.1:%d/shutdown" % self.port)   File "venv/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 124, in urlopen     return _opener.open(url, data, timeout)   File "venv/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 383, in open     response = self._open(req, data)   File "venv/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 401, in _open     '_open', req)   File "ans/venv/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 361, in _call_chain     result = func(*args)   File "venv/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 1130, in http_open     return self.do_open(httplib.HTTPConnection, req)   File "venv/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 1103, in do_open     r = h.getresponse()   File "venv/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 1030, in getresponse     response.begin()   File "venv/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 407, in begin     version, status, reason = self._read_status()   File "venv/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 371, in _read_status     raise BadStatusLine(line) BadStatusLine: '' ```  When chrome driver tries to quit, it throws this error spuriously. column3: Typo in method with webelement.py
column4: I am running the same selenium test I have been running everyday, except today I have been having a failure due to a typo I believe.   The test fails with AttributeError: 'WebElement' object has no attribute '_exceute':  The failure is found in File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webelement.py", line 375, in screenshot_as_base64     return self._exceute(Command.ELEMENT_SCREENSHOT)['value']  The failing method is:  ``` @property def screenshot_as_base64(self):     """     Gets the screenshot of the current element as a base64 encoded string.      :Usage:         img_b64 = element.screenshot_as_base64     """     return self._exceute(Command.ELEMENT_SCREENSHOT)['value'] ```  What is up with the word exceute here?

Protractor then inputs valid inputs in all fields, clicks Add which redirects users towards email sent page.  But on IE 11, before the test `‘Should redirect to email sent page on successful added company account’` is executed, the screen is not refreshed, fields are not cleared and protractor enters input values on the fields again which already has existing values from the test `‘Should disable create new account button before all inputs are valid’`.  Hence, the ‘Add’ button is shown as disabled. The screen looks like  below : ![ie11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16548367/12121737/81840d9c-b39c-11e5-96b7-35f912aaf484.png)  Hence, protractor fails the test by saying ‘addCompany’ doesn’t match with ‘emailSent’ url.  Here is the code which is executed   `````` //3. email addresses do not match     addCompanyPageObj.email.clear();     addCompanyPageObj.email.sendKeys(badEmail1);     addCompanyPageObj.retypeEmail.clear();     addCompanyPageObj.retypeEmail.sendKeys(retypeEmail);     browser.sleep(5000); expect(addCompanyPageObj.emailMatchMsg.getText()).toContain(translations.ACCOUNT.TIPS.EMAIL_MATCH);     expect(addCompanyPageObj.registerButton.getAttribute('disabled')).toBeTruthy();     browser.sleep(5000);    });```    fit('should redirect to email sent page on successful added company account', function () {   browser.sleep(10000);     addCompanyPageObj.companyName.sendKeys(companyName);      addCompanyPageObj.email.sendKeys(email);      addCompanyPageObj.retypeEmail.sendKeys(retypeEmail);     browser.pause();      global.setHttpReturnStatus(mockDataSource, '201');     global.scrollIntoViewAndClick(addCompanyPageObj.registerButton).then(function() {       browser.getCurrentUrl().then(function (url) {         expect(url).toMatch(/.*#\/emailSent/);  Note : Selenium standalone server version is 2.48.2           IEdriver version is 2.48  I am starting the selenium server from command prompt as : java -jar selenium-sevrer-standalone-2.48.2.jar -port 4444 -Dwebdriver.ie.driver="C:\

column3: .NET Bindings: proposal to standardize "localWebDriver" /RemoteWebDriver capabilities management
column4: I am not sure if I am using a correct term, for me there are "LocalWebDriver" bindings, which represent FirefoxDriver, ChromeDriver, InternetExplorerDriver classes and RemoteWebDriver binding implementation.   The thing is "LocalWebDriver" and RemoteWebDriver use different ways to pass the desired capabilities to the driver. What is even worse, every driver uses it's own class, such as FirefoxOptions, ChromeOptions etc. to customize the capabilities.   Eventually, "LocalWebDrivers" and RemoteWebDriver capabilities are being serialized to same JSON-wired data structure, so why do we have those multiple ways to set the capabilities inside the "LocalWebDrivers".   The issue:  - Having different capability implementations, I am not able to use the same Capability list for the local run (the run on the local machine, using "LocalWebDrivers") and RemoteWebDriver for same browser type. I have to implement the capability configuration individually for each browser type (e.g. Local Chrome and RemoteWebdriver).   Proposal:   1.Allow LocalWebDrivers to accept ICapabilities as a constructor parameters. Now only FirefoxDriver supports this, so I can use same list of capabilities for FirefoxDriver and for Firefox started via RemoteWebDriver. It is not possible to pass  ICapabilities to ChromeDriver or InternetExplorerDriver  ```         public FirefoxDriver(ICapabilities capabilities)             : this(ExtractBinary(capabilities), ExtractProfile(capabilities), capabilities, RemoteWebDriver.DefaultCommandTimeout)         {         } ```  2.Remove runtime checks such as:   ```         public void AddAdditionalCapability(string capabilityName, object capabilityValue, bool isGlobalCapability)         {             if (capabilityName == ChromeOptions.Capability ||                 capabilityName == CapabilityType.Proxy ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.ArgumentsChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.BinaryChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.ExtensionsChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.LocalStateChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.PreferencesChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.DetachChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.DebuggerAddressChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.ExtensionsChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.ExcludeSwitchesChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.MinidumpPathChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.MobileEmulationChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.PerformanceLoggingPreferencesChromeOption ||                 capabilityName == ChromeOptions.WindowTypesChromeOption)             {                 string message = string.Format(CultureInfo.InvariantCulture, "There is already an option for the {0} capability. Please use that instead.", capabilityName);                 throw new ArgumentException(message, "capabilityName");             } ... } ```   which artificially prevent to set the capability and implement merging with ICapabilities.   I believe this changes may reduce the configuration complexity for the WebDriver users and make the capability management more consistent.   You can count on me for making the code changes and conducting the experiments.  But, before doing anything, I would like to know what are @jimevans thoughts regarding this issue.   Thank you,  Dmytro

column3: Getting exception on Webelement.Click() though it clicks object in firefox
column4: I am getting the exception when i tried to click an object on webpage. This happens when a link is clicked and it opens a modal dialog. Webelement.click() function clicks on the link and the modal dialog is opened but Click() takes time to return and finally logs exception as 'The HTTP request to the remote WebDriver server for URL http://localhost:7055/hub/session/1c7fbb96-1c1a-4717-8208-25b5193de2df/element/%7B04f6c3b3-16ae-4352-879b-ff79ccd5713a%7D/click timed out after 60 seconds.'  I am using Selenium webdriver 2.48 for dotnet and using C#. I searched this topic and tried all the below solutions available but it behaves the same.  1. Use Sendkeys instead of CLICK() 2. Update the webdriver code and disable the redirection 3. Used firefoxProfile.SetPreference("dom.ipc.plugins.flash.disable-protected-mode", true); 4. Use below line to reduce the 60 sec FirefoxDriver(new FirefoxBinary(@"C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\Firefox.exe"), fp, TimeSpan.FromSeconds(2)); But this reduced to some extent ~30 sec. It waits in Click() method.  The issue is occurring only on firefox in both C# as well as Java. For IE browser, its working fine. Please let me know the solution.

column3: Documentation and handling of Selenium.prototype.getXYZ functions - Se IDE
column4: http://release.seleniumhq.org/selenium-core/1.0/reference.html#extending-selenium > 'Automatic availability...' gives an example: Selenium.prototype.getTextLength = function(locator, text) { return this.getText(locator).length; };  The problem: - have Selenium IDE 1.5 (and potentially earlier), up to Selenium IDE 2.9.1 (inclusive) - have a Selenium IDE core extension file, add such a function there - call the functions as an action in Se IDE script - i.e. getTextLength or storeTextLength - if the function definition has 1 parameter, then its value is passed OK. - If I define it with 2 parameters, then none of the parameters get their value - their typeof() will be undefined. That's contrary to the documentation.  This defect/undocumented feature/restriction is caused by the following line in registerAllAccessors() in selenium-commandhandlers.js (and in remote-selenium-commandhandlers.js):  var requiresTarget = (accessMethod.length == 1);  To make this more robust, that line should be:  var requiresTarget = (accessMethod.length >= 1);  Also, after loading Core extensions, IDE should generate a warning if any getXyz() or isXyz() method on Selenium.prototype expects two parameters (i.e. generate a warning if accessMethod.length>1).  (This issue is imported from https://code.google.com/archive/p/selenium/issues/3202.)

column3: Selenium IDE Export Capybara/RSpec
column4: Howdy.  I was wondering if it makes sense to add Capybara/RSpec export support to Selenium IDE. This would lower the barrier to entry for non-technical folks to write tests for our setup at work, which uses Capybara rather than standard Webdriver. There's a great similarity in Capybara and Webdriver, since Capybara just wraps Webdriver (I believe), and converting standard rspec `it` to `feature` is fairly trivial.  If this makes sense, I'd like to work on it. Please let me know what you think. Thanks!

column3: Timeout settings are confusing and inconsistent
column4: Hi, I need to extend the default timeout (as my test needs to sleep for a while) and I run into these two confusing behaviors of the Selenium server: #1. The hub settings  The docs say, the `-timeout` and `-browserTimeout` values should be in seconds:  > -timeout : an integer number of seconds we should allow a client to be idle  If the hub is started with timeout value provided: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.47.1.jar -role hub -timeout 900` the console prints: `timeout : 900000`. So it look like the internal representation is in ms. I think this (not the internal representation, but the config output and "config input" (= CLI params) should be consistent to avoid confusion about unit of the value. #2. The node settings  Also for the node, according to the help, the `-timeout` and `-browserTimeout` values should be in seconds. So I start the node with command `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.47.1.jar -role node -timeout 900`. But not when I check in the grid console the Configuration tab for the node, there is printed `timeout:900`. So is this ms or secs now?   Unlike the hub settings, it looks like the input value is actually in miliseconds here - when tested, the firefox browser window created by node run with this param (`-timeout 900`) is closed in less than few seconds (`WARN - session ext. key ... has TIMED OUT due to client inactivity and will be released.`], however, using miliseconds value (`-timeout 900000`) makes the node holding for 15 minutes. I also find few questions on Stackoverflow from people trying to use the seconds value on the node and reporting it not to be preventing the browser from timeout (which could simply be caused by the wrong unit used - secs/ms).  So the settings is inconsistent amongst hub, node and the documentation.

column3: Safari Driver is failing on latest mac and safari  -
column4: Hi,  Yosemite 10.10.3 & Safari 8.0.6 -- this combination is generating issues with latest selenium.  ```    Jul 18, 2015 7:31:00 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverServer start    INFO: Server started on port 11871   Jul 18, 2015 7:31:01 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverCommandExecutor start   INFO: Launching Safari   Jul 18, 2015 7:31:01 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverCommandExecutor start  INFO: Waiting for SafariDriver to connect  Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverChannelHandler$1      operationComplete   INFO: Connection opened   Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverChannelHandler$1   operationComplete    INFO: Connection opened    Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverChannelHandler$1 operationComplete    WARNING: Failed to register new WebSocket connection    Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverCommandExecutor start   INFO: Driver connected in 2627 ms   Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverCommandExecutor stop   INFO: Shutting down  Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverCommandExecutor stop  INFO: Closing connection  Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverCommandExecutor stop  INFO: Stopping Safari  Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverCommandExecutor stop  INFO: Stopping server  Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverServer stop  INFO: Stopping server  Jul 18, 2015 7:31:03 PM org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriverCommandExecutor stop  INFO: Shutdown complete  Could not start a new session. Possible causes are invalid address of the remote server or browser  start-up failure.   Build info: version: '2.46.0', revision: '61506a4624b13675f24581e453592342b7485d71', time: '2015-      06-04 10:22:50'   System info: host: 'Nabaruns-MacBook-Pro.local', ip: '192.168.1.100', os.name: 'Mac OS X', os.arch:  'x86_64', os.version: '10.10.4', java.version: '1.8.0_31'   Driver info: driver.version: SafariDriver ```  Now, here is the code that I try to use :   ``` java driver = new SafariDriver(); ```  The idea is that when it calls open - it fails.  ```     org.openqa.selenium.remote.UnreachableBrowserException: Could not start a new session.      ```  The source is, however -   ```     java.lang.ClassCastException: com.google.gson.JsonObject cannot be cast to java.lang.String ```  The issue of course, comes from [JsonToBeanConverter](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/92e0438571a80b5c6db2d65f297fab7a2c5c4620/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/remote/JsonToBeanConverter.java) at line 93.   ``` java if (Command.class.equals(clazz)) {       JsonObject json = new JsonParser().parse((String) text).getAsJsonObject(); ```  The text object is the JsonObject thingie - while this poor guy is expecting a string. Thus, probably an type check should fix it?

column3: Selenium 2.51.0 compatibility issues with Mozilla Firefox 44.0.2
column4: Hi,  I'm seeing some weird behaviour when trying to run protractor tests with the latest versions. ## Expected Behavior -  element.all(by.repeater('tab in $mdTabsCtrl.tabs')).get(1).click()  Should change to tab a position 1. Works fine in chrome. ## Actual Behavior -  Nothing happens, and no error is displayed. Tests just move on to whatever comes next.  Everything appears to be working fine, until we try to interact with elements that should be visible, the tests fail with the error 'Element is not currently visible and so may not be interacted with'. ## Steps to reproduce -  Set up a simple html - angularjs app try to switch between tabs with protractor test.

column3: Selenium IDE - Firefox 41 - Unsigned Extension - Issues installing it
column4: Hi, I'm using the Firefox Developer Edition 41, and I have to modify in about:config the preference to install Selenium ID: xpinstall.signatures.required From true to false. With this workaround I was able to install Selenium ID, but I was reading that in Firefox 42, it will not be possible to do this: "Firefox 42: Release and Beta versions of Firefox will not allow unsigned extensions to be installed, with no override." Here's the article from Mozilla: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Addons/Extension_Signing#Timeline  I know that Firefox on stable version is on 39, but eventually will be on the version 42.

column3: IE11: Failed to navigate using IEdriver on windows 7
column4: Hi, I am getting this error "call to the COM method IWebBrowser2::Navigate.failed()" while running rpsec. The browser launches but its unable to go to the url "This is the initial start page for the WebDriver server." This is the same problem I am seeing as mentioned in https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=4825&pli=1 but I couldn't add a comment there, so opening a new issue.   The url I am trying to launch is something like -> http://username:pwd@hostname:port/xxx I am using IEDriverServer_Win32_2.48.0 (32-bit installation) and browser is IE11 on windows 7.  Things done: - Set the registry - Zoom level is 100% - Disabled protection mode as per suggestions is https://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/InternetExplorerDriver#Required_Configuration - Rebooted machine  Any help would be appreciated.

column3: Safari Driver hangs on not finding an element
column4: Hi,    This issue is related to the latest safari driver 2.48 wherein the driver hangs on not finding a desired element in the page. The script execution is paused and will not timeout and will not continue or end till we manually quit the safari driver.

column3: Feature Docker images more prominently
column4: Hi,  While trying to set up our continuous integration environment to run Protractor tests we were somewhat stuff setting up Selenium- we try to have all of our infrastructure as code and for Selenium that's not trivial. However, after banging our heads for a while, we found out that you provide some official Docker images which work beautifully out-of-the-box and which we could add to our infrastructure trivially.  We would like to suggest featuring them more prominently, as they can be immensely helpful for newcomers- perhaps on the download page?  Cheers,  Álex

column3: Selenium returning wrong Platform/OS name when executed from local machine
column4: Hi,  To display the os name(on which test executes) in the final report we have used the following code in the selenium-java test  Capabilities cap = ((RemoteWebDriver) driver).getCapabilities();         System.out.println(cap.getPlatform());  When the above code executes  OS is displayed as ‘XP’ when script runs in Chrome browser on Win 7 desktop OS is displayed as ‘Windows’ when script runs in Firefox browser on Win 7 desktop  Please let us know if we can do something to get the correct platform/os name.  Thanks, Yatheesh.

column3: Proposal for using github releases to provide the latest .jar
column4: Hi,  Right now the .jar are uploaded to http://selenium-release.storage.googleapis.com/index.html, but I would  suggest to use (not as alternative but as a second possibility) to upload the JAR to the release:  ![capture 2016-02-03 at 13 44 42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1375475/12782555/4dfb1c76-ca7c-11e5-90c0-982ea8f7214e.png)  That way we could easily download with:  https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/releases/releases/latest  or with the Github Releases API https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/releases/#get-the-latest-release  how does it sound?

column3: Dead link in wiki
column4: Hi,  On the wiki's [ChromeDriver page](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/wiki/ChromeDriver) it states:  > For Linux systems, the ChromeDriver expects /usr/bin/google-chrome to be a symlink to the actual Chrome binary. See also the section on [overriding the Chrome binary location](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/wiki/ChromeDriver#Overriding_the_Chrome_binary_location.md)  That link https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/wiki/ChromeDriver#Overriding_the_Chrome_binary_location.md is dead. I'd also like to know a way to override the default location, but I may have found it at [https://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/ChromeDriver.wiki](https://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/ChromeDriver.wiki)  Regards, yb

column3: Consider removing multi_json dependency of ruby gem
column4: Hi,  JSON has been part of the ruby stdlib since 1.9.0 (see https://github.com/ruby/ruby/commit/af1c4167), and the latest version of selenium-webdriver requires ruby 1.9.2 or better.  Would you consider removing multi_json as a dependency, and just using `require 'json'` instead? Rails recently made a similar change (https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/23453), which has prompted other libraries to consider the same issue (like [simplecov](https://github.com/colszowka/simplecov/issues/458) and [stripe](https://github.com/stripe/stripe-ruby/pull/379)).  See also this recent [blog post](http://www.mikeperham.com/2016/02/09/kill-your-dependencies/).  Thanks for a great library!

column3: Unable to connect to host 127.0.0.1 on port 7055 after 45000 ms. Firefox console output:
column4: Hi,  It was working fine, but now i have trouble with firefox driver. I am not sure it can be by a update of firefox or not. It could be.  The error is when I do the                  driver = new FirefoxDriver(cap);  Driver runs the browser, but it can not be recovered in the variable "driver" for running tests. It fails in that line.  The capabilities are:         case FIREFOX:  ```         ProfilesIni allProfiles = new ProfilesIni();         FirefoxProfile profile = allProfiles.getProfile("default");         if (!os.equalsIgnoreCase("linux")) {             profile.setAcceptUntrustedCertificates(true);             profile.setAssumeUntrustedCertificateIssuer(false);         }          capabilities = DesiredCapabilities.firefox();         // capabilities.setPlatform(org.openqa.selenium.Platform.WINDOWS); ```  Note: I repeat it always worked fine untill now.  I have selenium-java versiom: 2.46.0 i tested with 2.28.2 too. And probles persists.  The version of firefox is: 40.0.3 in a windows 7 with operative system 64 bits.  Best regards,

column3: Defining custom commands
column4: Hi,  In order to implement some missing messages from mjsonWire protocol, I need to define some custom commands when using remote server. How can it be achieved?  I've tried using private executors from webdriver instance, but they does not give the defineCommand method.  The commands I need to implement are the ones related of manipulating session context:  ``` GET /session/:sessionId/context Get the current context (mjsonWire). POST /session/:sessionId/context Set the current context (mjsonWire). GET /session/:sessionId/contexts Get a list of the available contexts (mjsonWire). ```  https://github.com/admc/wd/blob/master/doc/jsonwire-full-mapping.md  I'm currently using javascript implementation of selenium-webdriver.  Thank you!

column3: Unable to get Safari 8.0.8 to work with Selenium 2.45 and 2.47.1
column4: Hi,  I'm trying to run a OS X 10.10.5 box with Safari 8.0.8 as a grid node, but i have no luck. When Im executing a test scenario on the specific node, it starts a Safari instance but the connection timed out. The reason for this is there is no WebDriver extension in Safari, _but_ if I start Safari on my own the extension (2.45) is installed and activated properly.  To start the node I'm executing:  ``` java -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.47.1.jar -role node -nodeConfig safari8config.json ```  safari8config.json  ``` {   "capabilities":       [         {           "browserName": "safari",           "maxInstances": 2,           "version" : "8",           "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver",           "platform": "MAC"         }       ],   "configuration":   {     "proxy": "org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy",     "maxSession": 2,     "port": 1338,     "host": "MY_HOST",     "register": true,     "registerCycle": 5000,     "hubPort": 1337,     "hubHost": "MY_HUB",     "browserTimeout": 60,     "timeout": 30000   } } ```  I would be very grateful for some advice.  Thank you.

column3: Running Selenium tests on a remote node from Jenkins
column4: Hi,  I'm trying to get selenium tests running on a remote node from Jenkins but the build fails with below error: Error Message  Could not start a new session. Possible causes are invalid address of the remote server or browser start-up failure. Build info: version: '2.47.1', revision: 'unknown', time: '2015-07-30 11:02:44' System info: host: 'ip-10-185-140-130', ip: '10.185.140.130', os.name: 'Linux', os.arch: 'amd64', os.version: '3.2.30-49.59.amzn1.x86_64', java.version: '1.7.0_76' Driver info: driver.version: RemoteWebDriver  The setup that I have is: 1. Selenium grid configured on a server outside of Jenkins server.  2. Hub and node both are running on this server 3. I have a maven project which is calling remoteWebDriver to connect to this standalone server driver = new RemoteWebDriver(new URL("http://138.12.28.196:4444/wd/hub"),capabilities);  When I run the test from Eclipse connectivity with the remote grid is established and the tests run on the remote server. Issue is seen only when I trigger the test from Jenkins(Linux machine) that I see "could not start a new session".   I also tried installing Selenium grid plugin on the Jenkins server and registering a node from a remote server(windows machine). The node registers to the hub running on Jenkins server. I changed the URL in RemoteWebDriver to point to the new Jenkins server IP. But even in this case the tests fail with error "Could not start a new session" , when triggered from Jenkins.  Is there any settings that needs to be done in Jenkins job or the Jenkins server or in the code for Jenkins job to be able to start a new session on a remote node?

column3: Typo in selenium-webdriver/docs/class_webdriver_WebElement.html
column4: Hi,  I wanted to try the following code in selenium-webdriver/docs/class_webdriver_WebElement.html ... var link = element.findElement(firstVisibleLink);  function firstVisibleLink(element) {   var links = element.findElements(By.tagName('a'));   return webdriver.promise.filter(links, function(link) {     return links.isDisplayed();   }).then(function(visibleLinks) {     return visibleLinks[0];   }); } ... It think there is a mistake :  ... return links.isDisplayed() ... should be replaced by : ... return link.isDisplayed() ... Thanks

column3: Grid Load Balancing Not Working
column4: Hi,  I have long suspected that something in the load balancing for the Grid is not working, as I see it using the same nodes over and over. I did some investigation and indeed it seems to be the case. The code in:  selenium/java/server/src/org/openqa/grid/internal/ProxySet.java  says:    public List getSorted() {     List sorted = new ArrayList(proxies);     Collections.sort(sorted, proxyComparator);     return sorted;   }    private Comparator proxyComparator = new Comparator() {     @Override     public int compare(RemoteProxy o1, RemoteProxy o2) {       double p1used = (o1.getTotalUsed() \* 1.0) / o1.getTestSlots().size();       double p2used = (o2.getTotalUsed() \* 1.0) / o2.getTestSlots().size();  ```   if (p1used == p2used) return 0;   return p1used < p2used? -1 : 1; } ```    };    public TestSession getNewSession(Map desiredCapabilities) {     // sort the proxies first, by default by total number of     // test running, to avoid putting all the load of the first     // proxies.     List sorted = getSorted();     log.info("Available nodes: " + sorted);  ``` for (RemoteProxy proxy : sorted) {   TestSession session = proxy.getNewSession(desiredCapabilities);   if (session != null) {     return session;   } } return null; ```    }  says it will sort them, but it doesn't seem to work, as you can see under "Actual Behavior" below it has 8 nodes but keeps using 4 over and over.  ``` // sort the proxies first, by default by total number of // test running, to avoid putting all the load of the first // proxies. ```  I've already got a fix in place as you can see from the "Expected Behavior", I will submit it unless anyone has a better idea @dima-groupon   It just uses a linked list to make sure Nodes being used go to the back of the list ## Expected Behavior - column3: Node configuration with JSON
column4: Hi,  I didn't really know where to post it, so I think an issue might be ok. When configuring a node with a JSON file, we've got:  ``` {"browserName": "firefox",   "platform": "WINDOWS"} ```  For Chrome and IE, we need to provide the custom path to driver. But, the driver property key is in the form `webdriver.BROWSER.driver`  Shouldn't it be better to be something like `driver` or `webdriver` to properly match a POJO class for example ? Because we can face:  ``` {"browserName": "chrome", "webdriver.chrome.driver": "chrome",   "platform": "WINDOWS"}  {"browserName": "internet explorer", "webdriver.ie.driver": "chrome",   "platform": "WINDOWS"} ```

column3: phantomjs web driver not closing socket
column4: Hi,  I am using phantomjsdriver 1.2.1 and selenium-java 2.47.1. I notice after every call to driver.quit(), the socket stays in CLOSE_WAIT state. It doesn't get closed, and end up wasting a lot file descriptors, eventually if I have a long running process, it will consume all sockets. Since my application needs to be up all the time, I have thousands of sockets in CLOSE_WAIT state.   If you simple run "driver.get(url) and then driver.quit()" in a for loop, then monitor the socket state with  "netstat -tonp", I see something like this:  tcp6       1      0 127.0.0.1:40791         127.0.0.1:7936          CLOSE_WAIT  16626/java       off (0.00/0/0) tcp6       1      0 127.0.0.1:44967         127.0.0.1:7431          CLOSE_WAIT  16626/java       off (0.00/0/0) tcp6       1      0 127.0.0.1:52849         127.0.0.1:23807         CLOSE_WAIT  16626/java       off (0.00/0/0) tcp6       1      0 127.0.0.1:44493         127.0.0.1:10229         CLOSE_WAIT  16626/java       off (0.00/0/0) tcp6       1      0 127.0.0.1:56702         127.0.0.1:22088         CLOSE_WAIT  16626/java       off (0.00/0/0) tcp6       1      0 127.0.0.1:34134         127.0.0.1:8235          CLOSE_WAIT  16626/java       off (0.00/0/0) ....  Please take a look at this problem. It really affects the stability of our application when we want it to be up all the time.   Thanks

column3: Firefox requests Proxy for localhost / local network connections
column4: Hi,  i am experiencing the following issue:  Firefox requests Proxy for localhost / local network connections  How to reproduce:  -Use a localhost Proxy e.g. OWASP ZAP -Use a local adress as base URL e.g. WebGoat -Optional: (use empty profile with about:blank)  Code-Example:  ``` import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;  import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;  import org.junit.After; import org.junit.Before; import org.junit.Test; import org.openqa.selenium.Proxy; import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver; import org.openqa.selenium.firefox.FirefoxDriver; import org.openqa.selenium.firefox.FirefoxProfile; import org.openqa.selenium.remote.CapabilityType; import org.openqa.selenium.remote.DesiredCapabilities;  public class caseIDE {     private WebDriver driver;     private String baseUrl;      @Before     public void setUp() throws Exception {          Proxy p = new Proxy();         p.setHttpProxy("localhost:8080");         p.setSslProxy("localhost:8080");         p.setFtpProxy("localhost:8080");          DesiredCapabilities cap = new DesiredCapabilities();         cap.setCapability(CapabilityType.PROXY, p);          FirefoxProfile fp = new FirefoxProfile();         fp.setPreference("browser.startup.homepage", "about:blank");         fp.setPreference("startup.homepage_welcome_url", "about:blank");         fp.setPreference("startup.homepage_welcome_url.additional", "about:blank");         driver = new FirefoxDriver(null, fp, cap);          baseUrl = "http://localhost:9999";         driver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS);      }      @Test     public void testIpw() throws Exception {         driver.get(baseUrl + "/WebGoat");         Thread.sleep(5000);         assertEquals("1", "1");     }      @After     public void tearDown() throws Exception {         driver.quit();     } } ```  Expected: The WebGoat call gets proxied through OWASP ZAP. Actual Result: A Proxy Authentication Pops up for the proxy that is set in IE. After dismissing it, the execution continues Further info: Firefox makes some automated calls to Mozilla which are supposed to happen. But they are not proxied through the Proxy set by WebDriver!? When using regular Firefox the behaviour does not occur  UPDATE: Replacing `driver = new FirefoxDriver(null, fp, cap);` with   ``` fp.setPreference("network.proxy.type", 1); fp.setPreference("network.proxy.http", "localhost"); fp.setPreference("network.proxy.http_port", 8080); driver = new FirefoxDriver(null, fp); ```  is a workaround which works.. so i assume that the issue is somewhere in the handling of the Capabilities  UPDATE2: I had a more detailed look on the sources: (RemoteWebDriver.java and FirefoxDriver.java)  1.) startClient -> starts Firefox with the specified Profile 2.) startSessions -> submits the Capabilities to the Webdriver created in 1.)  There are a few Milliseconds delay where the Profile (if not using any preconfigured one) is set to "Use system proxy settings" because it is the default of Firefox: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Network.proxy.type. When the Driver receives the command to switch to localhost the proxy-popup caused by the automated request was already done. -> Conclusion: Proxy settings must be set directly in the Profile and Capabilities should not be used for Proxy settings Is there any way to make the Capabilities work?

column3: Selenium with chrome hangs because it is using too much ports
column4: Hi,  I am dealing with a issue that really seems to be the same as https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=2492 which is mentioned as fixed since Oct 2011.  I am using Apache nutch (1.11) with selenium (2.48.2) using chrome driver (with chrome on version 48.0.2564.103) to crawl a list of specific URLs. It all works fine for a while and I see for each page fetched the line: Starting ChromeDriver 2.21.371461 (633e689b520b25f3e264a2ede6b74ccc23cb636a) on port X  where the port keeps changing. after a while all the fetch threads hung and it seems to be related to errors on ports being in use: [0.491][SEVERE]: bind() returned an error, errno=98: Address already in use  I can't see any more issues/errors/exceptions so I really hope this information can lead us somewhere. Am I doing something wrong with my setup?  Do you know of this issue? Is there a way to go around it?  Thank you António

column3: Windows authentication/NTLM - settings ignored?
column4: Hi,  Does the driver server respect any of the settings set in Internet Options -> Security?  I have set within 'Intranet zone' that the browser should automatically logon as the current machine username and password. When I log into that machine, and launch IE manually, I don't get the authentication prompt and IE correctly uses that setting to log me in as the windows machine login.  When firing off web tests through selenium, I get errors that a modal dialog is present, indicative that the driver server fires up IE without taking that setting into consideration, and doesn't log me in.  I'm aware of the fact that we can't interact with the dialog, etc so don't expect that but just wondered if that setting is being ignored or perhaps I am missing something in the startup config to get that to work?

column3: Firefox binaries at custom paths don't work on mac
column4: Hi there,  quite a few developers (myself included) have their firefox binaries not at /Applications/Firefox but somewhere else.  Thats way https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/py/selenium/webdriver/firefox/firefox_binary.py#L145 doesn't work for me.  Now I've solved this for my projects by monkey patching selenium to make it ask the system where firefox is instead of assuming it is in /Applications.  That looks something like this:  ``` python class Monkey(object):     def patch(self):         import sys         if not sys.platform.startswith('darwin'):             return         def find_firefox_path(self):             from subprocess import check_output             import os             firefox_path = check_output(["mdfind", "kMDItemFSName = Firefox.app"]).decode('utf-8').strip()             return os.path.join(firefox_path, "Contents/MacOS/firefox-bin")         from selenium.webdriver.firefox.firefox_binary import FirefoxBinary         FirefoxBinary._get_firefox_start_cmd = find_firefox_path Monkey().patch() ´´´  Why don't you adapt that to get into selenium proper so I don't have to monkey patch this anymore? ```

column3: Opening hyperlink in new Tab working intermittently (Actions class)
column4: Hi Team Use case / Scenario: I am trying to open hyperlinks in new tab using Actions class Code: `actions.keyDown(Keys.SHIFT).click(webElement).keyUp(Keys.SHIFT).build().perform();` Expected: Hyperlink should open in new Tab. Actual: Hyperlinks open in new tab intermittently. The above functionality is not giving consistent results. At times the link just gets selected and does not opens in new Tab.  Unit Test: Repeat below code multiple times and failure can be re-created.  ``` import java.util.List; import java.util.Set;  import org.openqa.selenium.By; import org.openqa.selenium.Keys; import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver; import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement; import org.openqa.selenium.firefox.FirefoxDriver; import org.openqa.selenium.interactions.Actions;  public class FFStackTest {     public static void main(String[] args) {         WebDriver driver=new FirefoxDriver();         Actions actions=new Actions(driver);         driver.manage().window().maximize();         driver.get("http://stackoverflow.com");         List elements = driver.findElements(By.xpath(".//*[text()='javascript']//ancestor::div[@class='summary']/h3/a"));         String originalWindow=driver.getWindowHandle();         for (WebElement webElement : elements) {             webElement.sendKeys("");             actions.keyDown(Keys.SHIFT).click(webElement).keyUp(Keys.SHIFT).build().perform();             Set windowHandles=driver.getWindowHandles();             windowHandles.remove(originalWindow);             driver.switchTo().window(windowHandles.toArray(new String[windowHandles.size()])[0]);             System.out.println(driver.getTitle());             driver.close();             driver.switchTo().window(originalWindow);         }         driver.close();     } } ```  Webdriver - Firefox combinations tried so far: Selenium Webdriver: 2.48.2.. till latest selenium 2.51.0 Firefox version: 41.0.2 till 44.

column3: selenium taking screenshots larger than expected
column4: Hi selenium team, I have a question on the browser.takeScreenshot() functionality.  Using you in conjunction with Protractor...  It seems I can set the window/browser size.. via a call such as  ```     describe("login", function () {          it("should go to login page", function () {             browser.driver.manage().window().setSize(width, height);             browser.get('/');             expect(browser.getTitle()).toEqual("MyTitle");             browser.takeScreenshot().then(function(png) {                 var stream = fs.createWriteStream("somepathandfilename");                 stream.write(new Buffer(png, 'base64'));                 stream.end();            });         }); ```  The result of this process isn't matching the browser drivers dimensions.. I can work around this but just wondering, why?  Resulting image in the case of a width x height = 367 x 667 , was turned into 800x1190

column3: IEDriver isDisplayed not catching Hidden attribute
column4: Hi Selenium contributors,  I recently discovered that isDisplayed returns TRUE in IE9, IE10 & IE11 for elements that have the hidden attribute.  So there are 4 ways to hide nodes that I know of. CSS styles... Opacity:0, Display:none, Visibility:hidden , and all of these seem to work. But if you use the hidden attribute ...  For example:    ...   ...this returns isDisplayed = true. However, it is not displayed and should return FALSE. It correctly returns false for Chrome and Firefox.

column3: Selection failing on some select boxes
column4: Hi Guys,  This is really a question. The select perfectly works, most of the time. However, there is this one page - where in selection  - it generates Javascript error ( events fails ). There, the select is not working. I tried reproing it - by creating a small local file - and injecting javascript error on selection change event - but it is still able to select.  Now, I need to know that is it possible that due to some javascript error - can selection be cancelled? What really happens is this :  -  The select ( combo box ) gets clicked -  Instead of the item getting selected - we see the whole popup of the combo box  - Now the item gets selected - but the popup does not disappear ( the item does not get selected actually )  - The popup stays there, and the code breaks.  Need to know cause of such a behaviour. Please help! Thanks,  -- Noga

column3: IE Driver produces inconsistent results with HTML5 window post messaging
column4: Hi everyone, I have an application which uses the HTML5 window messaging to communicate between two different browser windows. This communication works fine outside of my automated tests and with Selenium with the Chrome Webdriver, but is inconsistent with the IE Webdriver. Sometimes it works, others it doesn’t and I can’t find a rhyme or reason to it.  Here is what the application does: 1.  A parent page is loaded 2.  A button is clicked on the parent page to launch a new child window 3.  When the child window is launched, it sends a window.postMessage back to the parent page 4.  The parent page receives this message to then create channel messaging with ports  From logging results, I can see that the child window always sends the message, but the parent window does not always receive it. The parent and child windows are in the same domain. Here is the test code, it’s pretty straight forward:  ```    driver.get( "http://localhost:8081/parentPage.html" );    WebElement childButton = driver.findElement(By.id("launchBrowserButton"));    assertThat( childButton.isEnabled(), is(true) );    childButton.click(); ```  Please let me know if you need any more information.  Thanks, Tawni

column3: Selenium Webdriver Unable to Click x-tree-expander
column4: Hi Everyone,  I use Selenium WebDriver 2.47.1 and Firefox 40.0.3 to automate an ExtJS application using XPath locator strategy.  However for some reason with Firefox browser, I am not able to click on the x-tree-expander to expand the tree node even though it worked on Chrome browser with chrome 2.14 driver in a Linux environment.  The XPath is verified to be correct and actually the x-tree-expander was clicked without error. However the node did not get expanded. No issue with StaleElementReferenceException or other WebDriverExceptions.  The XPath has been verified to be correct using Firebug.  XPATH = “//div[contains(@class,'x-tree-view')]//table[contains(@class,'x-grid-item-selected')]//img[2]” or “//div[contains(@class,'x-tree-view')]//table[contains(@class,'x-grid-item-selected')]//img[contains(@class,'x-tree-expander')]  I would like to know if anyone has successfully used Selenium to expand a tree  node using Selenium WebDriver with java client or server version 2.44 or 2.47.1?      Appreciate if anyone can provide feedback on this could be a genuine bug ?  Thanks

column3: Cannot work with pages like about:config
column4: Hi all, sorry my poor English (know Ukraine, Russian)  For some tests need change about:config settings on the fly, but how? column3: Chrome + profile. POST session fails with Net::ReadTimeout
column4: Hi all, trying to launch and use Chrome with certain existing profile with selenium on ruby.  Code is very simple:  ``` ruby driver = Selenium::WebDriver.for :chrome, :service_log_path => "d:\\chromedriver.log", :switches => [ '--profile-directory=Profile 2', '--user-data-dir=C:\\Users\\myuser\\AppData\\Local\\Google\\Chrome\\User Data', '--log-level=10', '--enable-logging', '--v=10'] driver.navigate.to "http://google.com" ```  This  - opens a new Chrome window for the 'Profile 2' profile indeed - set the focus to address line - blocks on the very first line of code above and fails with the following trace after about a minute:  ``` d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/protocol.rb:158:in `rescue in rbuf_fill': Net::ReadTimeout (Net::ReadTimeout)     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/protocol.rb:152:in `rbuf_fill' d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http/response.rb:39:in `read_status_line'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http/response.rb:28:in `read_new'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http.rb:1406:in `block in transport_request'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http.rb:1403:in `catch'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http.rb:1403:in `transport_request'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http.rb:1376:in `request'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http.rb:1369:in `block in request'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http.rb:852:in `start'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/2.0.0/net/http.rb:1367:in `request'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/http/default.rb:107:in `response_for'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/http/default.rb:58:in `request'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/http/common.rb:59:in `call'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:664:in `raw_execute'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:122:in `create_session'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:87:in `initialize'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/chrome/bridge.rb:48:in `initialize'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:60:in `new'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:60:in `for'     from d:/Install/Ruby/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.48.1/lib/selenium/webdriver.rb:86:in `for'     from profile.rb:8:in `' -> POST session    >>> http://127.0.0.1:9515/session | {"desiredCapabilities":{"browserName":"chrome","version":"","platform":"ANY","javascriptEnabled":true,"cssSelectorsEnabled":true,"takesScreenshot":false,"nativeEvents":false,"rotatable":false,"chromeOptions":{"args":["--profile-directory=Profile 2","--user-data-dir=C:\\Users\\myuser\\AppData\\Local\\Google\\Chrome\\User Data","--log-level=10","--enable-logging","--v=10"],"detach":true},"chrome.switches":["--profile-directory=Profile 2","--user-data-dir=C:\\Users\\myuser\\AppData\\Local\\Google\\Chrome\\User Data","--log-level=10","--enable-logging","--v=10"],"chrome.detach":true}}      > {"Accept"=>"application/json", "Content-Type"=>"application/json; charset=utf-8", "Content-Length"=>"589"} ```  If I remove  ` --profile-directory=Profile 2', '--user-data-dir=C:\\Users\\myuser\\AppData\\Local\\Google\\Chrome\\User Data' ` from 'switches' everything runs smoothly without any exceptions  - opening new window for temporary profile - sets data:, in the address line without focusing into it - passes control to the next lines of code  I tried ChromeDriver v.2.19 and 2.20 with the same outcome. Any suggestions or guidance would be very appreciated.  Regards, Mark

column3: Firefox 42.0 Linux selenium 2.48 Not able to change firefox user settings
column4: Hi All, I am not able to save the file directly from Firefox during the test case is running by webdriver. The browser is opened as a root. Normally when I manually open browser it works fine. It does not work with Firefox 42 and 40. However, it works with v39.  I modified ../../../../../python2.7/dist-packages/Selenium2Library/resources/firefoxprofile/prefs.js but unfortunately the changes are not visible in GUI view directly in Firefox. In my opinion the problem can be with access rights or some other configuration files need to be change.  Does anybody have a similar issue and can give any hint? Thanks, Regards,

column3: sendKeys() will not append to the existing text in Rich Text Editor
column4: Hi All,  I tried to type some text in the Rich Text Editor with sendKeys() function, but I found this method won't append to the existing text, and it will always type in the first label  HTML:    ```                           ``` #   JAVA Code:  WebDriver driver = ....; driver.switchTo().frame(...); driver.findElement(...);  String text = "Test B I U Number Hyperlink";  String[] singleCharacters = str.split("");  ```     // Interval is 0.3 second between each type of character, this is to     // simulate real human action ```  for (int i = 0; i < singleCharacters.length; i++) {      if (!StringUtils.isEmpty(singleCharacters[i]))      {          driver.sendKeys(singleCharacters[i]);          Thread.sleep(300);      } }  Selenium: 2.48.2 Browser: Firefox 41 Java Version: JDK 1.7  Attached: screenshot using selenium 2.47 screenshot using selenium 2.48 ![selenium 2-48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16423729/11991644/9e012138-aa57-11e5-83c9-3b5a41f5f7cf.png) ![selenium 2-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16423729/11991645/9e2d591a-aa57-11e5-819f-fd32692bc554.png)

column3: Not able to drag and drop between two iframes
column4: Hi All,  I have two frames parent and child. I would like to perform a drag and drop functionality between these two frames. I am using the following code to perform the required action.But I am unable to succeed. I am able to see that the element is getting Hold but unable to drop in the dropable location. Can you please let me know is this a LIMITATION of selenium or any other work around.  Code that i have tried:  driver.switchTo().frame("parentframe"); Actions builder = new Actions(driver);     builder.clickAndHold(elementtodrag);     Action action = builder.build();     action.perform();  ``` driver.switchTo().frame("child frame"); builder = new Actions(driver); builder.moveToElement(destination).perform(); builder.build(); builder.release(); builder.release(destination).perform();    ```

column3: Chrome driver sometimes not closed properly
column4: Hi All,  I have a test suite of over 300 tests. When I run all tests at one go, 30% of tests fail because Chrome driver sometimes doesn't gets closed at the end of test which makes the subsequent tests to fail.   The test errors out at the beginning with error trace below. The following errors occurs because the driver object was not launched and it can't find the object reference of WebDriver.   Error trace given below ExceptionHandler function threw exception System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.  The same test suite runs well on FF and Safari on Mac.  Is there any issue filed for this with Selenium HQ?  Or Is there any workaround /solution to this?  Thanks in advance.

column3: Cannot find elements of a iOS app page in appium inspector for Mac
column4: Hi all! I am automating an iOS app using appium. I can find most of all the elements in the app pages but there are certain pages that appium inspector cannot find. Instead the appium inspector shows elements of the previous page.  I can see the page i want to detect but cannot see the element names on the left hand side ![screen shot 2015-12-18 at 10 46 26 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10496932/11890009/b736f9a2-a575-11e5-93a8-9c4c1940e889.png) ![screen shot 2015-12-18 at 10 47 34 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10496932/11890010/b78dba62-a575-11e5-9e7d-5c6636ae8393.png)  If you see the first screenshot you will see table cells of electricity, gas, landline etc. I can see and find properties for all of this page's elements but when i go for the next page, lets say I click on electricity, i cannot see any property for any element(you can see it the second screenshot).  I tried providing the name of the Bill Pay button as it is the only element I want to use in the page but to no avail. I have tried giving various xpaths again to no success.  What is the problem here? is it the appium inspector? is it the app? or am i missing something?

column3: IE11 + Selenium Webdriver - Execution suspends with no action when a click method is encountered in code
column4: Here is my config: Windows 7 VM + Selenium Web Driver + IE 11 + IE Driver Server 64 bit v2.39  I have a weird problem, where in, when a click event is encountered in code, the execution just suspends and doesn't proceed. I was able to overcome this by using sendKeys(Keys.Enter) instead of click. But i see the same behavior while trying to switch to a popup window and returning back to the parent frame.   Request you to fix this. Thanks!!

column3: Selenium Safari Web driver Extension in Grid requires refresh to display icon active state.
column4: Hello:  I can run a Safari test fine in a Grid framework using the Safari Web Driver Extension.  (1.) The Safari icon displayed in the Selenium Grid console requires a screen refresh to properly reflect that the Safari icon is grayed out, or busy.   (2.) The Selenium Grid console only displays one Safari icon even when the "maxInstance-10" property is set on a MAC node. All of the Windows nodes display 10 browser icons when the "maxInstance-10" property is set.  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11888483/9044702/d8c05544-39e3-11e5-9970-94c20871438a.png)  Thanks,

column3: Selenium IDE pluggins SeLite Run All Favorites error
column4: Hello, i have some problems about installation of Selenium IDE & some pluggins, on a new machine Windows7, with Firefox 42.0 & Selenium IDE 2.9.0. column3: Encoded symbols in JavaDoc
column4: Hello, guys!  Seems after migration to Java 8 in some cases after JavaDoc generation some symbols were not decoded.  https://selenium.googlecode.com/git/docs/api/java/org/openqa/selenium/support/ui/FluentWait.html  See the Sample section:  ```  Wait<WebDriver> wait = new FluentWait<WebDriver>(driver) ```

column3: Webdriver remote capabilities for Microsoft Edge (selenium-webdriver 2.47.1)
column4: Hello,  selenium webdriver capabilities have wrong browser_name for Microsoft edge.(should be similar to ie)  ``` Selenium::WebDriver::Remote::Capabilities.edge  {     :browser_name       => "MicrosoftEdge",     :platform           => :windows,     :javascript_enabled => true   } ```  The reason is:  When selenium node is configured  with "browserName": "edge"   selenium throw error: "Driver info: driver.version: unknown"  When selenium node is configured  with "browserName": "MicrosoftEdge" desired capabilities cannot find browser_name='edge'

column3: scroll / focus does not work (Selenium 2.49.0)
column4: Hello,   When `location_once_scrolled_into_view` or `focus` used to bring element to the visible part of the screen so that it can be safely clicked.   Case 1: when element is located on the upper part of the page,focus brings it to the most top of the visible part of the screen, such that if you have any "menu or header" on top of the page element will not be visible after using focus/scroll.  Case 2: I have not tested it but i'm assuming if you have some footer that is always on the page it element will be hidden behind as well.  why focus brings element to the most top / bottom of the page rather then to the middle.....  ```       Element is not clickable at point (1822, 7). column3: Unable to launch Chrome with option "AddTracingCategory" .NET
column4: Hello,   **## Expected Behavior -**#  Start Chrome driver using the option "PerformanceLoggingPreferences" to collect events from Network domain.  It seems like the issue  #1591 was not fixed.  **## Actual Behavior -**# I am trying to launch Chrome using the option "PerformanceLoggingPreferences" but i got this error :  unknown error: cannot parse capability: chromeOptions  from unknown error: cannot parse perfLoggingPrefs  from unknown error: unrecognized performance logging option: tracingCategories    (Driver info: chromedriver=2.21.371459 (36d3d07f660ff2bc1bf28a75d1cdabed0983e7c4),platform=Windows NT 6.1 SP1 x86_64)  **## Steps to reproduce -**# Selenium DLL : 2.52 Chrome version : 48 ChromeDriver version : 2.21.371459  `ChromePerformanceLoggingPreferences perfLogPrefs = new ChromePerformanceLoggingPreferences(); ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions(); perfLogPrefs.AddTracingCategories(new string[] { "devtools.timeline" }); options.PerformanceLoggingPreferences = perfLogPrefs;  IWebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(options);`  Thank you.

column3: Selenium IDE 2.9.0 hangs forever when clicking on a button, making tests impossible (Repro @ Plnkr)
column4: Hello, I've googled this issue and over the years it seems that selenium hangs on click occurred multiple times.  I am running Firefox Developer Edition 42.0a2 (2015-08-28) and when I execute  this selenium code:  ``` html      click     id=aGetNotified       ```  An angular js page hangs (with the browser and with selenium ide)  Here is the plunker html page that causes the hang, additionally there is a SeleniumIDE file which is a valid Selenium IDE Test case. http://plnkr.co/edit/SxLRyEQTf5Sp53rDhEXe Just visit the index file with the link and input displayed and execute the selenium test -> freeze.  I realized that this line:   ``` js el.focus(); // or  el.select(); ```  causes the freeze, unfortunately I need this feature :/

column3: Struggling with Firefox Browser.
column4: Hello, I'm writing some tests using intern. I'm not sure if this is an intern issue or a selenium one. So I posted in both sides. :-1:  The same tests run well against Google Chrome, by the way. This is my configuration:  Firefox ESR v 38.2.1 Windows 7 x64 Selenium Standalone server 2.47.1 Intern v3.0.3  Intern.conf.env: environments: [{ browserName: 'firefox', version: '38', platform: 'WINDOWS'}]  This is the output of selenium server: http://pastebin.com/duDcGYp1 Basically, the browser starts, does stuff, closes by itself, then my test fail, and finally a new browser windows has been opened.  Can anyone suggest any solution? Or am I missing something? Thanks.

column3: selenium-bom for Maven artifacts?
column4: Hello,  would it make sense to have `org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-bom` which would define versions (in `dependencyMangement`) of all Selenium Java artifacts?   There is already a BOM that is being maintained by Arquillian community (https://github.com/arquillian/arquillian-selenium-bom). It needs to be maintained by someone else and it needs to be kept up to date. If it would be directly in Selenium source, it would be automatically available with every new release.  Are there reasons why it was decided not to have such BOM? Or it simply wasn't done yet? (I might have some time to help here...)

column3: IEDriver blowing up on child windows containing only a PDF...
column4: Hello, I'm using Ruby (without Rails) selenium-webdriver gem 2.51.0. In one of our tests, we click a link that spawns a child window that only contains a PDF. Our code is blowing up when we try to get the current url for that window (i.e., driver.current_url). The code works when we use version 2.48 of the IEDriver executable, but not when we use 2.49 - 2.51. The error that we're getting is 'No connection could be made because the target machine actively refused it. - connect(2) for "127.0.0.1" port 5555.' The code that we use to declare our driver follows: caps = Selenium::WebDriver::Remote::Capabilities.ie caps['ignoreProtectedModeSettings'] = true caps['ignoreZoomSetting'] = true caps['javascriptEnabled'] = true caps['acceptSslCerts'] = true caps['nativeEvents'] = true caps['takesScreenshot'] = true caps['handlesAlerts'] = true caps['requireWindowFocus']= true # caps['proxy']= ieproxy localdriver = Selenium::WebDriver.for :ie, :desired_capabilities => caps My IE uses a proxy if that matters... The link on my test page that launches the child window is... Basic PDF my 'openWIN' function basically boils down to... window.open(url,'','width=1000,height=600,scrollbars='+scrollbar_setting+',resizable=no,status=yes');

column3: unknown error: session deleted because of page crash from tab crashed with Selenium plugin on Jenkins
column4: Hello,  I'm experiencing issues using chromedriver with Selenium plugin on Jenkins. On my local machine, my tests run with no issues, but as soon I run them remotely, I get this error:  unknown error: session deleted because of page crash from tab crashed   (Session info: chrome=45.0.2454.101)   (Driver info: chromedriver=2.19.346078 (6f1f0cde889532d48ce8242342d0b84f94b114a1),platform=Windows NT 6.2 x86_64) (WARNING: The server did not provide any stacktrace information) Command duration or timeout: 3.81 seconds Build info: version: '2.41.0', revision: '3192d8a', time: '2014-03-27 17:17:32' System info: host: 'ECS-8ebd4f06', ip: '127.0.1.1', os.name: 'Windows 8', os.arch: 'x86', os.version: '6.2', java.version: '1.8.0_51' Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver Capabilities [{applicationCacheEnabled=false, rotatable=false, mobileEmulationEnabled=false, chrome={userDataDir=C:\Users\tmp}, takesHeapSnapshot=true, databaseEnabled=false, handlesAlerts=true, hasTouchScreen=false, version=45.0.2454.101, platform=WIN8, browserConnectionEnabled=false, nativeEvents=true, acceptSslCerts=true, locationContextEnabled=true, webStorageEnabled=true, browserName=chrome, takesScreenshot=true, javascriptEnabled=true, cssSelectorsEnabled=true}]  I have the latest of Selenium and Chrome and the driver but nothing.  Selenium 2.47 Chrome 45 ChromeDriver 2.19 Hub OS: Linux Slave OS: Windows 7 or 8  I also tried to adjust timeouts but none of that helped either. An interesting thing is that, since it's through Jenkins, you can have a slave on the same server as the hub, and when that is the case, the tests run with no problem. And the same tests run in FF remotely with no problem.  I am at a loss here. Any help would be really appreciated.  Thank you!

column3: WebDriver holds many TCP ports
column4: Hello,  Apologies if this isn't the right way to ask this, but I can't find much more information elsewhere.  We have written a Java WebDriver application that we run many concurrent instances of, each of which runs many multi-step Selenium tests.  As the number of concurrent tests has inreased, we've occassionally been hitting "java.net.SocketException: No buffer space" exceptions.  We've applied relevant OS level patches for similar problems, so it's not (just) that.  On further investigation, it seems that each WebDriver test holds dozens of ports open... and even after the driver has shut down cleanly, these are held in TIME_WAIT for some time.    Is this expected behaviour?  It's causing us quite a few resource problems, with thousands of sockets stuck in TIME_WAIT.  For info, there seems to be many java > browser/driver and browser/driver connections, as well as (the more expected) browser > webpage sockets.  Chrome seems to have less of the driver > Java connections than Firefox, but still has lots of the others.  But generally it seems that every WebDriver interaction results in at least 3 sockets being hogged (Java > browser, browser > Java, browser  webpage), sometimes more (example below)  Is this all expected?  Might it be amended in future?  Cheers, Marc #    ...  TCP    127.0.0.1:7055         COMPUTERNAME:64378        TIME_WAIT  TCP    127.0.0.1:7055         COMPUTERNAME:64380        TIME_WAIT  TCP    127.0.0.1:7055         COMPUTERNAME:64385        TIME_WAIT  TCP    127.0.0.1:7055         COMPUTERNAME:64409        ESTABLISHED [firefox.exe]    ...   TCP    127.0.0.1:64384        COMPUTERNAME:7055         TIME_WAIT   TCP    127.0.0.1:64386        COMPUTERNAME:7055         TIME_WAIT   TCP    127.0.0.1:64387        COMPUTERNAME:7055         TIME_WAIT   TCP    127.0.0.1:64409        COMPUTERNAME:7055         ESTABLISHED  [java.exe]   ...   TCP    10.111.34.81:56076     webserver-02:8080       TIME_WAIT   TCP    10.111.34.81:56079     webserver-02:8080       ESTABLISHED  [firefox.exe]   TCP    10.111.34.81:56080     webserver-02:8080       ESTABLISHED  [firefox.exe]   TCP    10.111.34.81:56081     webserver-02:8080       ESTABLISHED  [firefox.exe] #

column3: Unable to navigate to site after firefox update to V43
column4: Hello Team ,   I was using selenium 2.46 and firefox 42 (Windows 7/8)  for my automation works. Today my firefox got updated to 43. After this my automation scripts are not working. Browser gets launched but the navigation to the site is not working. I tried the same after updating  with Selenium 2.48.2. But no response.   Could anyone help.  Regards,

column3: IFrame || evaluate.js related bug. w/ workaround.
column4: Hello I'm pretty puzzled about what is happening Hopefully someone more knowledgeable can give some insight. I am currently using:  windows 8.1 / Selenium dotnet 2.52.0 / Firefox 38.6.1 ESR I am testing and application that has divs that display content in a iframe.  We call them modal popups.  The problem happens after I click a button which causes a post back and displays the frame.  And not always on the same test, but always after a post back action to display and then switch to an iframe.  The error that I get is:  Unable to locate element:{xxxxx} I then get another error on the test tear down: waiting for evaluate.js load failed (UnexpectedJavaScriptError) my tear down trys to execute some javascript to find open modals (iframes) and close them.  additionally I added a javascript executer that executed a script that would check if that the dom was loaded before trying to find the iframe and i get the "waiting for evaluate.js load failed" error before finding the frame.  which leads me to believe that this is the true source of the problem.  I expected the dom with the browser saw the frame and was able to select my frame with jquery. I also tried catching the exception.  I inspected the driver element's page source and saw the iframe there to.  I was able to find this workaround which is basically a retry, but this is clearly not working as intended.  ```             WebDriverWait wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, new TimeSpan(0,0,10));             try             {                 wait.Until(ExpectedConditions.FrameToBeAvailableAndSwitchToIt(By.Id("mm_m_mh_internalFrm_framePnlCtl_nsiframe")));             }             catch             {                 wait.Until(ExpectedConditions.FrameToBeAvailableAndSwitchToIt(By.Id("mm_m_mh_internalFrm_framePnlCtl_nsiframe")));             } ```  My Tests have not failed since this change.   Can anyone give insight to what is actually going on?

column3: Impossible to registering the node to the hub
column4: Hello I got an error when on my log file. It seems if I add a new node with selenium grid extra pointing on my hub. I got this error below in the log. column3: Firefox can't find the file at chrome://src/content/RemoteRunner.html?
column4: Hello all,   recently I updated my linux distribution to the latest version and suddenly all my selenium tests stopped working. Still I can't identify what is the difference in the setup so as to spot the cause of the problem.   The problem is that the Firefox spawns, but it doesn't proceed with the selenium test execution with the following error:  ``` Firefox can't find the file at chrome://src/content/RemoteRunner.html?sessionId=3ea54ef0e48e4861b1cdcda73af2fdbf&multiWindow=true&baseUrl=http://192.168.171.193/login.html&debugMode=false&driverUrl=http://localhost:4444/selenium-server/driver/. ```  The selenium server version is  _2.48.2_ Firefox version: _43.0.3_ robotoframework/seleniumlibrary: _2.9.2_  Any tip to help identify the problem, will be more than welcome.

column3: Unable to get an element via query on attribute(containing hyphens) value using an XPATH
column4: Hello All,  Hope everybody is doing great. I'm facing very weird scenario in getting an element having an attribute using an XPATH. The problem is that if the attribute contains more than one Hyphens in it then Selenium is unable to find that element. I am using **Python**. And **Selenium 2.52.0**.  **Example that works fine.**  ```   XPATH = '//*[@data-one="containingOnlyOneHyphen"]' (Works Completely Fine) ```  **Example that doesn't work.**  ```   XPATH = '//*[@data-one-two="containingTwoHyphen"]' (Does not work :/ ) ```  So far my understanding with this issue is that Selenium is unable to find element based on attribute having more than 1 hyphens in it.  It would be great if you can guide me anything regarding this issue. I've almost tried everything but failed.  Thanks & kind Regards,  Hassan Mehmood

column3: Selenium IDE garbles relative paths to test cases when saving a suite
column4: Hello :)  I'm experiencing the issue described [here](http://everythingsqa.tumblr.com/post/1367487846/selenium-relative-path-issues).  When saving a suite in the IDE, if it contains test cases that reside in a parent or sibling folder, it'll save garbled relative paths that'll make the IDE throw an exception when you try to re-open the suite later.  Example:  The suite: `/Users/daniel/Projects/some-project/test/browser/suites/create-user/create-user.html`  References the (shared) test case: `/Users/daniel/Projects/some-project/test/browser/suites/lib/log-in-as-admin.html`  Expected test case href when saving (and required when opening) the suite: `log in as admin`  Actual href when saving: `log in as admin`  It looks like every folder in the path is simply replaced by two dots? Seems like an easy bug to fix :)  I can correct this manually, but it's a short-lived fix, because the next time I save the suite in the IDE, it'll re-garble the paths.  The work-around using absolute paths suggested by the blogger in the link referenced above is not viable here, as we are a number of people sharing these tests via git and creating and running them on different setups.   Selenium IDE 2.9.1 in Firefox 44.0.2 on Mac OS X 10.11.3  Cheers :)

opt, arg in opts:     if opt == '--query':         query = arg  box = driver.wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located(     (By.NAME, 'q'))) box.send_keys(query) ```  **error**  ``` Error: Traceback (most recent call last):   File "selenium_scrape.py", line 95, in      main()   File "selenium_scrape.py", line 86, in main     lookup(driver, query)   File "selenium_scrape.py", line 28, in lookup   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webelement.py", line 469, in _execute     return self._parent.execute(command, params)   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 199, in execute     response = self.command_executor.execute(driver_command, params)   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/remote_connection.py", line 392, in execute     data = utils.dump_json(params)   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/utils.py", line 32, in dump_json     return json.dumps(json_struct)   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/__init__.py", line 243, in dumps     return _default_encoder.encode(obj)   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/encoder.py", line 207, in encode     chunks = self.iterencode(o, _one_shot=True)   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/encoder.py", line 270, in iterencode     return _iterencode(o, 0) UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0xf8 in position 0: invalid start byte ```  **full script**  ``` python import sys import time import getopt import urllib from pyvirtualdisplay import Display from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC from selenium.common.exceptions import TimeoutException from selenium.webdriver.common.proxy import *  def error(str):     print>>sys.stderr, str     sys.exit(1)  def wait_results(driver):     driver.wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located(         (By.ID, 'resultStats')))  def lookup(driver, query):     if query:         url = 'https://www.google.dk'         driver.get(url)          try:             box = driver.wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located(                 (By.NAME, 'q')))             box.send_keys(query)             button = driver.wait.until(EC.element_to_be_clickable(                 (By.NAME, 'btnG')))             button.click()         except TimeoutException:             error('Box or Button not found in google.com')          try:             wait_results(driver)             driver.get(url+'/search?q='+urllib.quote_plus(query)+'&start=0&num=100')             wait_results(driver)             print driver.find_element_by_tag_name('body').get_attribute('innerHTML').encode('utf-8')         except TimeoutException:             error('No results returned by Google. Could be HTTP 503 response')     else:         error('Query not set')  def main():     use_proxy = True      #   Start display     display = Display(visible=0, size=(800, 600))     display.start()      #   Init args     query = ''     proxy_string = ''     try:         opts, args = getopt.getopt(sys.argv[1:], '', ['query=','proxy='])         for opt, arg in opts:             if opt == '--query':                 query = arg             elif opt == '--proxy':                 proxy_string = arg     except getopt.GetoptError as err:         error(str(err))      #   Init proxy     proxy = ''     if proxy_string:         proxy = Proxy({             'proxyType': ProxyType.MANUAL,             'httpProxy': proxy_string,             'ftpProxy': proxy_string,             'sslProxy': proxy_string,             'noProxy': ''         })      #   Init driver     try:         if (use_proxy and proxy):             driver = webdriver.Firefox(proxy=proxy)         else:             driver = webdriver.Firefox()         driver.wait = WebDriverWait(driver, 5)     except selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException as err:         error(str(err))      lookup(driver, query)      time.sleep(5)     driver.quit()      #   Stop display     display.stop()  if __name__ == '__main__':     main() ```

column3: homebrew install of chromedriver is into /usr/local/bin/
column4: Hardcore Mac devs can install chromedriver through regular (non cask) homebrew, and stay abreast of releases through standard `brew upgrade`. The binary goes into /usr/local/bin/   WebDriver could well look there, if paths are not inherited by launching processes.  ``` bash $ which chromedriver  $ brew install chromedriver ==> Downloading https://chromedriver.storage.googleapis.com/2.21/chromedriver_ma Already downloaded: /Library/Caches/Homebrew/chromedriver-2.21.zip ==> Caveats To have launchd start chromedriver at login:   ln -sfv /usr/local/opt/chromedriver/*.plist ~/Library/LaunchAgents Then to load chromedriver now:   launchctl load ~/Library/LaunchAgents/homebrew.mxcl.chromedriver.plist ==> Summary 🍺  /usr/local/Cellar/chromedriver/2.21: 3 files, 11M, built in 2 seconds $ which chromedriver  /usr/local/bin/chromedriver ```

column3: Use directExecutor().
column4: Guava 18 deprecated sameThreadExecutor() and split the use case into two options: newDirectExecutorService() and directExecutor(). Use directExecutor() as we don't need ExecutorService#shutdown semantics and this has a positive performance impact.

column3: Change webdriver.testing.jsunit to fail if no tests are found
column4: goog.testing.TestRunner defaults to failing if no tests are found, but webdriver.testing.jsunit overrides that check, so empty test suites cause false positives. I duplicated the check from goog.testing.TestRunner.prototype.execute, changing it from throwing to firing an error event.

column3: Selenium grid jar file missing from Maven respository
column4: Go to https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/openqa/selenium/grid/selenium-grid/1.0.2/  There is a zip file and a POM but no Jar file.

column3: IEDriver - getWindowHandles doesn't return handle of newly opened window when protected mode is off
column4: Getting this weird problem where after opening the new winow driver.getWindowHandles() returns only 1 handle when protected mode is OFF. Same code works fine when protected mode is ON for all the security zones and returns 2 handles. Not expecting this behavior as we are not ignoring the protected mode setting and keeping it same for all zones. Even IEDriver log indicates "Has Valid Protected Mode Settings: 1" for both the cases. Thanks. [IEDriverLog_ProtectedModeOff.txt](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/files/37707/IEDriverLog_ProtectedModeOff.txt) [IEDriverLog_ProtectedModeOn.txt](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/files/37708/IEDriverLog_ProtectedModeOn.txt)
