column3: selenium-chromedriver won't select frame inside a nested frameset
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  test case to select the appropriate frame and check its name.  ## Actual Behavior -  NoSuchFrameError with the chrome driver and test case passes with both the internet explorer and firefox driver. If you remove the nested frameset tag and keep all three frames, the chrome driver passes the test case.  ## Steps to reproduce -  HTML used  ```    HTML Target Frames                                        ```  FrameHandler.js  ``` var webdriver = require('selenium-webdriver');  var FrameHandler = function (driver) {      this.switchToFrame = function (name)     {             if (typeof name !== 'string' || name === '' || !name)             {                 console.log('error');             }             else             {                 console.log(this.getCurrentFrameName(function (name) {                     console.log(name + ' this is the current frame before switch');                 }));                  console.log(name + ' switch to this frame');                 return driver.switchTo().frame(name);             }     };      this.getCurrentFrameName = function (callback)     {         driver.executeScript('return self.name').then(function (name)         {             return callback(name);         });     }; };  module.exports = FrameHandler; ```  Unit Test  ``` var webdriver = require('selenium-webdriver'); var chrome = require('selenium-webdriver/chrome'); var chromePath = require('selenium-chromedriver').path; var FrameHandler = require('../../JS-Selenium-Toolkit/src/FrameHandler'); var expect = require('chai').expect;  describe('FrameHandler', function () {    it('Should pass if the set frame is main_page', function (done) {         this.timeout(15000);          var service = new chrome.ServiceBuilder(chromePath).build();         chrome.setDefaultService(service);          var chromeDriver = new webdriver.Builder()             .withCapabilities(webdriver.Capabilities.chrome())             .build();          var frameHandler = new FrameHandler(chromeDriver);          //check current frame name         frameHandler.getCurrentFrameName(function (name) {             console.log(name + ' current frame inside second function');         });        chromeDriver.get('http://orasi.github.io/Selenium-Java-Core/sites/unitTests/orasi/utils/frameHandler.html').then(function () {         frameHandler.switchToFrame('top_page').then(function () {             frameHandler.switchToFrame('main_page').then(function () {                 frameHandler.getCurrentFrameName(function (name) {                     console.log(name + ' this frame was switched to ');                     expect(name).to.equal('main_page');                     done();                 });             });          });       });   }); }); ```

column3: Error when `switch_to.parent_frame` in PhantomJS and Safari
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  switch_to.parent_frame should switch to parent frame context ## Actual Behavior -  ``` # ``` ## Steps to reproduce -  ``` rb @page.find_elements(:tag_name, "iframe").each do |iframe|   @page.switch_to.frame(iframe)   # eval some JS here   @page.switch_to.parent_frame rescue => e   # error caught here   @page.switch_to.default_content end ```  Using selenium-webdriver ruby gem. Issue manifests under versions 2.52.0 and 2.46.2 (I was originally running 2.46.2, upgraded to 2.52.0 to try and resolve issue but still occurring)  Error occurs on PhantomJS 2.1.1. No errors with Firefox or Chrome. However Safari (latest driver: 2.48) reports a similar error:  ``` # ```  FWIW, I get the exact same errors for PhantomJS/Safari when running under watir-webdriver 0.8.0, while watir+Firefox and watir+Chrome work fine.  On the other hand, Capybara works just fine on PhantomJS and Safari.

column3: Webdriver Cannot Resolve localhost when using IPV6 on Alpine Linux
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  Selenium webdriver on Alpine Linux should resolve localhost when using ipv6 address ## Actual Behavior -  Selenium webdriver gives error the following error when `/etc/resolv.conf` containers a ipv6 address for localhost: - `/etc/hosts`  ``` 127.0.0.1       localhost ::1     localhost ip6-localhost ip6-loopback fe00::0 ip6-localnet ff00::0 ip6-mcastprefix ff02::1 ip6-allnodes ff02::2 ip6-allrouters ``` - Selenium Error  ```      SocketError:        getnameinfo: Unrecognized address family or invalid length      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/platform.rb:188:in `getaddrinfo'      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/platform.rb:188:in `localhost'      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/phantomjs/service.rb:50:in `initialize'      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/phantomjs/service.rb:46:in `new'      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/phantomjs/service.rb:46:in `default_service'      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/phantomjs/bridge.rb:38:in `initialize'      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:72:in `new'      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:72:in `for'      # ./vendor/bundle/ruby/2.2.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver.rb:86:in `for' ``` ## Steps to reproduce - - Start an interactive Alpine Linux container on a system with IPV6 configured  `docker run -it --rm alpine /bin/sh` - Verify `/etc/hosts` has a ipv6 local address for localhost  ``` cat /etc/hosts 127.0.0.1       localhost ::1     localhost ip6-localhost ip6-loopback fe00::0 ip6-localnet ff00::0 ip6-mcastprefix ff02::1 ip6-allnodes ff02::2 ip6-allrouters 172.17.0.2      bc0435cdfe24 ``` - Install ruby  ``` apk --no-cache add ruby ruby-irb ``` - Run an interactive ruby shell and run the code from https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/rb/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/platform.rb#L196  ``` / # irb irb(main):001:0> require 'socket' => true irb(main):002:0> Socket.getaddrinfo "localhost", 80, Socket::AF_INET, Socket::SOCK_STREAM SocketError: getnameinfo: Unrecognized address family or invalid length         from (irb):2:in `getaddrinfo'         from (irb):2         from /usr/bin/irb:11:in `' irb(main):003:0> ```  This error message comes from musl libc which Alpine Linux uses (https://github.com/BlankOn/musl/blob/master/src/network/gai_strerror.c)  Redis had a similar issue at one point and was updated to account for both ipv4 and ipv6 addresses: https://github.com/redis/redis-rb/issues/393

column3: selenium==2.52 version says that it is 2.51
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  Selenium python package version is 2.51 where it should be 2.52   ``` In [2]: selenium.webdriver.__version__ Out[2]: '2.51.0' In [5]: selenium.__version__ Out[5]: '2.51.0' ``` ## Actual Behavior -  Version should be 2.52 ## Steps to reproduce -  Install the latest selenium using pip or easy_install

column3: [Python] Opening Chrome (Incognito mode) with default Extension: Not working [Severe Bug]
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  Opening google chrome (**Incognito mode**) with default **extension** already installed then go to site: http://google.com ## Actual Behavior -  After opened the chrome (Incognito mode) with extension but not working the `driver.get("http://google.com")` This code is doing nothing. ## Steps to reproduce -  ``` import time, os from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options  executable_path = "C:\chromedriver_win32\chromedriver"  chrome_options = Options()  # Private browsing chrome_options.add_argument("--incognito")  # To use my default extension chrome_options.add_argument(r"user-data-dir=C:\Users\Mika\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\User Data")  driver = webdriver.Chrome(executable_path=executable_path, chrome_options=chrome_options)  driver.get("http://google.com") # This code is not working  time.sleep(60)  # 60 seconds sleep/delay driver.quit() ```  Please help me, I want to automate my google chrome.

column3: Offset Locators

column3: Maven Download Corrupted Jar Files From SeleniumHq
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  Maven to download correct jar files of seleniumhq ## Actual Behavior -  Maven download corrupted jar files Contents of the corrupted jar files contains html tag:                                      html, body, #partner, iframe {                 height:100%;                 width:100%;                 margin:0;                 padding:0;                 border:0;                 outline:0;                 font-size:100%;                 vertical-align:baseline;                 background:transparent;             }             body {                 overflow:hidden;             }                                                                                               document.write(                     ''                     + ''             );                ![attempttoopenjarfile](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17617343/13497136/dca10538-e121-11e5-8aed-a69c799d1714.png) ![contentsofjarfile](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17617343/13497137/dca1a632-e121-11e5-8e49-d8870f7cd978.png) ## Steps to reproduce -  Add org.selenium.seleniumhq as a dependency in the pom.xml file:              org.seleniumhq.selenium             selenium-ie-driver             2.52.0   Run a mvn -skipTests=true clean install against the pom.xml file Go to the repository -> org -> seleniumhq -> selenium -> selenium-ie-driver -> 2.52.0 Attempt to open the jar file -> Error complaining about the file being corrupt or invalid Attempt to open the jar file with Notepad++ -> see html tag

column3: Element Scroll Behavior ignored when Element is already within the Viewport, but not visible/clickable
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  In an environment with a fixed top navigation bar, scrolling can hide elements behind the bar. If an element is hidden behind the bar, but can be scrolled-to by the user, it should be scrolled into view before the driver attempts to click (or otherwise interact) with the element. ## Actual Behavior -  When attempting to click an element outside the viewport, the driver will first scroll the element to either the top or bottom of the viewport depending on the elementScrollBehavior capability (related to #1202). When attempting to click an element INSIDE the viewport, but hidden behind a fixed navigation bar, the driver makes no attempt to scroll the element into view and an exception is thrown. ## Steps to reproduce -  Versions:  ``` xml            org.seleniumhq.selenium       selenium-java       2.52.0       test                 org.seleniumhq.selenium       selenium-server       2.52.0       test      ```  JUnit test:  ``` java   @Test   public void testInitialOverlapWontScroll()   {     DesiredCapabilities caps = new DesiredCapabilities();     caps.setCapability(CapabilityType.ELEMENT_SCROLL_BEHAVIOR, ElementScrollBehavior.BOTTOM);     FirefoxDriver driver = new FirefoxDriver(caps);     try     {       driver.get("http://localhost/1740.jsp");       System.out.println("Traversing buttons top-down.");       for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)       {         System.out.println("BEFORE: Clicking button "+i);         driver.findElement(By.cssSelector("#button"+i)).click();         System.out.println("AFTER: Clicking button "+i);       }       System.out.println("Traversing buttons bottom-up.");       for (int i = 9; i >= 0; i--)       {         System.out.println("BEFORE: Clicking button "+i);         driver.findElement(By.cssSelector("#button"+i)).click();         System.out.println("AFTER: Clicking button "+i);       }     }     finally     {       driver.quit();     }   } ```  HTML Page:  ``` html                body {         padding: 0px;         margin: 0px;         margin-top: 203px;               }       .overlay {         border: 1px dashed red;         background-color: #cccccc;         z-index: 1000;         position: fixed;         top: 0px;         height: 200px;         width: 100%;         padding: 0px;         margin: 0px;       }       .overlay a {         width: 100%;         height: 100%;         display: block;         border: 1px solid green;       }             div {         background-color: #eeeeee;         text-align: center;         vertical-align: middle;         border: 1px dashed blue;         height: 200px;         width: 100%;         padding: 0px;         margin: 0px;       }                       Overlay Link                 Button0                 Button1                 Button2                 Button3                 Button4                 Button5                 Button6                 Button7                 Button8                 Button9          ```  Program output:  ``` Traversing buttons top-down. BEFORE: Clicking button 0 AFTER: Clicking button 0 BEFORE: Clicking button 1 AFTER: Clicking button 1 BEFORE: Clicking button 2 AFTER: Clicking button 2 BEFORE: Clicking button 3 AFTER: Clicking button 3 BEFORE: Clicking button 4 AFTER: Clicking button 4 BEFORE: Clicking button 5 AFTER: Clicking button 5 BEFORE: Clicking button 6 AFTER: Clicking button 6 BEFORE: Clicking button 7 AFTER: Clicking button 7 BEFORE: Clicking button 8 AFTER: Clicking button 8 BEFORE: Clicking button 9 AFTER: Clicking button 9 Traversing buttons bottom-up. BEFORE: Clicking button 9 AFTER: Clicking button 9 BEFORE: Clicking button 8 AFTER: Clicking button 8 BEFORE: Clicking button 7 AFTER: Clicking button 7 BEFORE: Clicking button 6 *** Exception org.openqa.selenium.WebDriverException: Element is not clickable at point (705, 50). Other element would receive the click:  ```

column3: Python Selenium Client is by default resolving ip adresses and not sending domain names
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  If the configured endpoint is app.testobject.com the HTTP request should got to app.testobject.com and not the ip address behind app.testobject.com ## Actual Behavior -  when setting the selenium endpoint to a domain the outgoing http request is going to the ip adress. That confuses WebServers which are proxying commands to the selenium backend, as they usually use domain names and not ip addresses to find the right config. ## Steps to reproduce -  Initiate a session to an non local endpoint (e.g. one of the cloud testing providers like sauce and browserstack). Record the http requests using Charles Proxy (or Wireshark). The request is send to an ip instead to the domain.  The problem can be found here:  https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/py/selenium/webdriver/remote/remote_connection.py#L165  I would recommend to change the default behaviour to false.

column3: Firefoxdriver is still hardcoding a port, for internal use, causing collisions in concurrent runs
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  I expected to see that the SocketLock uses a random port or a port based on the webdriver_firefox_port I pass in as a profile preference. But it seems it is using a hardcoded port-1 which always gives it port 7054, causing collisions in concurrent sessions.  https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/ab1e647d0fc8fc39e6b00ae94321ab228b6728f2/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/firefox/FirefoxDriver.java#L304 ## Actual Behavior -  you will see that webdriver_firefox_port does honor this value, but if you inspect the SocketLock under these objects, it still uses 7054 all the time! I think that should be either based on this port or another randomly selected port ## Steps to reproduce -  Run any Firefoxdriver test, but pass in a profile prefernce of    profile.setPreference(FirefoxProfile.PORT_PREFERENCE, openPort);

column3: delete_all_cookies and multiple workers
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  Hi, when I run selenium with phantomjs, python celery using multiple workers. There seems to be conflict between the different sessions, or that sessions interfere with each other.   Does driver.delete_all_cookies() delete cookie for all sessions?  Simple code example  ``` class browser(Task):     def __init__(self):         dcap = dict(DesiredCapabilities.PHANTOMJS)         dcap["phantomjs.page.settings.userAgent"] = (             "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/53 "             "(KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/15.0.87"         )         self.driver = webdriver.PhantomJS(desired_capabilities=dcap)         self.driver.set_window_size(1024, 768) # optional      def get_data(self,x):         x = json.loads(x)          if True:             self.driver.delete_all_cookies()             self.driver.get('http://www.mysite.com')             sbtn = self.driver.find_element_by_id( "ctl00_ctl00_MainWrap_MainContent_FullRegion_ContentLeftRegion_ContentLeftMenuRegion_RekoFilter_ctl00_tbVIN")             sbtn.send_keys(x['key'])             self.driver.find_element_by_id( "ctl00_ctl00_MainWrap_MainContent_FullRegion_ContentLeftRegion_ContentLeftMenuRegion_RekoFilter_ctl00_btnSearch").click()             car_info = self.driver.find_element_by_class_name("carInfo")   @app.task(name='hent_bilnummer_biltema', base=browser) def get_something(_):     get_something.get_data(_) ``` ## Actual Behavior -  Browser cannot find element, wrong page. ## Steps to reproduce -  It works with just one worker not multiple

column3: EnableMobileEmulation does not work when passing custom device settings.
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  EnableMobileEmulation should enable mobile emulation including pixel ratio and touch screen abilities. ## Actual Behavior -  EnableMobileEmulation does nothing when a custom device settings object is passed. It does work when a Chrome supported device string is passed in ("Samsung Galaxy Note 3" for example).  I've peeked into the .dll at ChromeOptions.cs and it appears that dictionary2 is created within the following function but it not actually returned anywhere. It looks like only the user-string is being passed to dictionary1 which is being returned from the function.  ---  `private Dictionary GenerateMobileEmulationSettingsDictionary() {     Dictionary dictionary1 = new Dictionary();     if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(this.mobileEmulationDeviceName))         dictionary1["deviceName"] = (object) this.mobileEmulationDeviceName;     else if (this.mobileEmulationDeviceSettings != null)     {         dictionary1["userAgent"] = (object) this.mobileEmulationDeviceSettings.UserAgent;         Dictionary dictionary2 = new Dictionary();         dictionary2["width"] = (object) this.mobileEmulationDeviceSettings.Width;         dictionary2["height"] = (object) this.mobileEmulationDeviceSettings.Height;         dictionary2["pixelRatio"] = (object) this.mobileEmulationDeviceSettings.PixelRatio;         if (!this.mobileEmulationDeviceSettings.EnableTouchEvents)             dictionary2["touch"] = (object) (bool) (this.mobileEmulationDeviceSettings.EnableTouchEvents ? 1 : 0);     }     return dictionary1; }`  --- ## Steps to reproduce -  The following function should allow me to pass in custom device settings which enable mobile emulation.  `internal static IWebDriver GetWebDriver(this MobileDevice currentDevice) {     ChromeMobileEmulationDeviceSettings deviceSettings = new ChromeMobileEmulationDeviceSettings();  ``` deviceSettings.Width = 360; deviceSettings.Height = 640; deviceSettings.PixelRatio = 3; deviceSettings.UserAgent = "Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; U; Android 4.3; en-us; SM-N900T Build/JSS15J) AppleWebKit/534.30 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0 Mobile Safari/534.30"; deviceSettings.EnableTouchEvents = true;  ChromeOptionsFixed chromeOptions = new ChromeOptionsFixed(); chromeOptions.EnableMobileEmulation(deviceSettings);  IWebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(chromeOptions); driver.Manage().Window.Size = new Size((int)deviceSettings.Width, (int)deviceSettings.Height);  return driver; ```  }`

column3: Page source for plaintext websites adds html tags
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  driver.page_source method should not add html tags to plaintext websites `'217.23.14.168'` ## Actual Behavior -  driver.page_source adds html tags to plaintext websites `217.23.14.168` ## Steps to reproduce -  `firefox http://whatismyip.akamai.com` CTRL+U  ``` ruby require 'selenium-webdriver'  driver = Selenium::WebDriver.for :firefox driver.navigate.to 'http://whatismyip.akamai.com' puts driver.page_source driver.quit ```  This bugs me because`driver.find_element(:tag_name, 'body').text` will throw an error for PhantomJS:  ``` Selenium::WebDriver::Error::UnknownError: {"errorMessage":"undefined is not an object (evaluating '(y(a)?y(a).parentWindow||y(a).defaultView:window).getComputedStyle(a,null).MozTransform.match')","request":{"headers":{"Accept":"application/json","Accept-Encoding":"gzip;q=1.0,deflate;q=0.6,identity;q=0.3","Cache-Control":"no-cache","Connection":"close","Host":"127.0.0.1:8910","User-Agent":"Ruby"},"httpVersion":"1.1","method":"GET","url":"/text","urlParsed":{"anchor":"","query":"","file":"text","directory":"/","path":"/text","relative":"/text","port":"","host":"","password":"","user":"","userInfo":"","authority":"","protocol":"","source":"/text","queryKey":{},"chunks":["text"]},"urlOriginal":"/session/ff41cef0-e159-11e5-a43f-09ba5f34e17e/element/:wdc:1457021235983/text"}} (org.openqa.selenium.WebDriverException) from /var/lib/gems/2.1.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.52.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/response.rb:70:in `assert_ok' ```

column3: DLLs aren't signed
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  Dll for the Selenium WebDriver as well as the Support aren't signed, which would create issues for consuming from the signed dlls. ## Actual Behavior -  They should be signed. ## Steps to reproduce -  To verify the behaviour you can use the sn.exe tool (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/k5b5tt23.aspx) and check the dll with this tool.

column3: With Firefox 45 calling a method on a closed window can throw an `UnknownError`
column4: ## Expected Behavior -  Calling a method on a window that's been closed should throw a `NoSuchWindowError`. ## Actual Behavior -  It throws a `UnknownError`. ## Steps to reproduce -  Firefox 45.0 selenium-webdriver 2.50.0  ``` ruby require "selenium-webdriver"  driver = Selenium::WebDriver.for :firefox driver.navigate.to "http://google.com" driver.execute_script('window.open("http://google.com")') driver.close  begin   driver.execute_script('return window.getErrors;') rescue Selenium::WebDriver::Error::NoSuchWindowError => e   puts e rescue Selenium::WebDriver::Error::UnknownError => e   puts e end ```

column3: Selenium WebDriver for .Net does not work IE11 when WebComponents.js present
column4: ## Expected Behavior  WebDriver should be able to find an element on page. ## Actual Behavior  WebDriver can't find an element on page if [WebComponents.js](https://github.com/webcomponents/webcomponentsjs) is loaded and the browser is IE11. This happens at least for methods `By.XPath` and `By.CssSelector`.  The below test project tries Firefox and IE11 driver. Only IE11 fails on this.  My environment is Windows 10 64-bit, using Selenium for .Net.   Versions used: NUnit 2.6.4, NUnitTestAdapter 2.0.0, Selenium.Support 2.52.0, Selenium.WebDriver 2.52.0, WebDriver.IEDriverServer.win64 2.44, WebComponents.js 0.7.21 ## Steps to reproduce  I have created a test project to recreate the issue: https://github.com/warpech/SeleniumTest - Test file: https://github.com/warpech/SeleniumTest/blob/gh-pages/UnitTest1.cs - HTML that works: https://github.com/warpech/SeleniumTest/blob/gh-pages/wwwroot/regular.html - HTML that doesn't work: https://github.com/warpech/SeleniumTest/blob/gh-pages/wwwroot/webcomponents.html  For example, the following test:  ``` IWebElement element = wait.Until(driver => driver.FindElement(By.XPath("(//h1)[1]"))); ```  Fails with error:  ``` Test Name:  Polyfill_BodyElementExists Test FullName:  SeleniumTests.MarcinNunit("internet explorer").Polyfill_BodyElementExists Test Source:    C:\www\warpech\SeleniumTest\UnitTest1.cs : line 78 Test Outcome:   Failed Test Duration:  0:00:18.645  Result StackTrace:   at OpenQA.Selenium.Support.UI.DefaultWait`1.ThrowTimeoutException(String exceptionMessage, Exception lastException) at OpenQA.Selenium.Support.UI.DefaultWait`1.Until[TResult](Func`2 condition) at SeleniumTests.MarcinNunit.Polyfill_BodyElementExists() in C:\www\warpech\SeleniumTest\UnitTest1.cs:line 83 --NoSuchElementException at OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver.UnpackAndThrowOnError(Response errorResponse) at OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver.Execute(String driverCommandToExecute, Dictionary`2 parameters) at OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver.FindElement(String mechanism, String value) at OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver.FindElementByXPath(String xpath) at OpenQA.Selenium.By.c__DisplayClasse.b__c(ISearchContext context) at OpenQA.Selenium.By.FindElement(ISearchContext context) at OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver.FindElement(By by) at SeleniumTests.MarcinNunit.c.b__10_0(IWebDriver driver) in C:\www\warpech\SeleniumTest\UnitTest1.cs:line 83 at OpenQA.Selenium.Support.UI.DefaultWait`1.Until[TResult](Func`2 condition) Result Message:  OpenQA.Selenium.WebDriverTimeoutException : Timed out after 10 seconds   ----> OpenQA.Selenium.NoSuchElementException : Unable to find element with xpath == (//h1)[1] ```  ![2016-03-08 18_52_20-seleniumtest - microsoft visual studio](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/566463/13610897/2641f98a-e560-11e5-9c9f-e5f9a0083e2e.png)

column3: JS confirm() Defaulting to True After Selenium IDE Script Run in Same Firefox Session
column4: # Description  Our team was running scripts to enter data in one page that will be queried on another page for a manual test. After the data entry scripts were run, in the same Firefox session the user navigated to the page to manually test and selected a radio button that should present a confirm dialog when selected. The confirm dialog was not displayed. Investigating further led to a reference note about Selenium IDE and confirm():  > By default, the confirm function will return true, having the same effect as manually clicking OK. This can be changed by prior execution of the chooseCancelOnNextConfirmation command.   If the user were to run the script, then close down Firefox/Selenium IDE (or open private browsing), and then navigate to the page for manual testing, the radio button confirm prompt will display.   It appears that once Selenium IDE is used at all to run a script, default behavior for confirm() is injected into the Firefox session. The expectation would be that once a selenium script is run, Selenium IDE cleans up any browser overrides in that session. # (Expected) Steps to reproduce  Given I have run a Selenium IDE script And no active script or recording is running When I enter 'confirm("test")' in the Firefox dev tools console  Then I expect a confirmation dialog with "test" to display # (Actual) Steps to reproduce  Given I have run a Selenium IDE script And no active script or recording is running When I enter 'confirm("test")' in the Firefox dev tools console  Then the console is returning true   In the below gif I first run a script, then enter the confirm("test") command in the console. Dialog is suppressed auto defaulting to true. I then switch to a new tab and enter confirm("test") in console, dialog is displayed. ![20160111-selenium-1460](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2506649/12244868/9fbb7c9c-b873-11e5-94b3-00063228f096.gif)

column3: How to update the Firefox WebDriver? The WebDriver is disabled by latest firefox.
column4: ![screen shot 2015-12-21 at 12 05 35 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4313040/11959061/65f7f204-a899-11e5-8e83-85168fb96158.png)  My Firefox WebDriver suddenly stopped working after updating firefox to 43.0.1 (See attached screenshot). I tried to disable the xpinstall.signature.required in about:config but the WebDriver still been disabled in the new session when running my automation.  I had to manually install the old version 41.0 of firefox to continually use the WebDriver 2.47.01. Is there any way , steps to update my existing WebDriver to the latest?

case "enabled": Func_FindObj(ORvalname, ORvalue); boolval = elem.isEnabled(); System.out.println(boolval); actval = boolval.toString(); System.out.println(actval); break; I am doing keyword driven automation testing using selenium open to test frame work. I write the web page elements and their path in one file and the actions to be performed on them in the other. I am supposed to check if the link is enabled for a particular kind of user or not. I am using this method to check that. But 'boolval' always returns 'true' for any given link no matter it is enabled or disabled. Is there any other way to check if the link is enabled. If not in-built can we write our own method to check? The only difference between the enabled and disabled element is the presence of 'href' in the anchor tag and the name of the class.
